title: Finance Assistant
description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a detail-oriented Accounting Assistant to manage client invoicing, payment tracking, and accounts receivable processes. This role involves maintaining and updating the Customer Balance Sheet to ensure all invoices and amounts are accurately recorded, distributing invoices and balance summaries daily via Slack channels, and uploading financial files to clients' Google Drives for organized record-keeping. You will record client payment proofs, monitor and allocate Payoneer payments to individual client accounts, and support payment issue resolution by verifying documentation when required. Your proactive approach will be essential in tracking overdue balances, following up on long-outstanding amounts, providing end-of-week balance updates for high-balance clients, and preparing twice-weekly financial reports including Payoneer summaries and unpaid invoice lists, while assisting in resolving client finance-related concerns to maintain strong relationships and healthy cash flow.



The ideal candidate is a meticulous and organized professional with strong attention to detail and experience in accounts receivable or client billing processes. You possess excellent communication skills that enable you to interact professionally with clients through Slack and
 while maintaining clear records and documentation. Your proficiency with spreadsheets, payment platforms like Payoneer, and file management systems allows you to work efficiently and accurately across multiple client accounts. Proactive and service-oriented, you take initiative in following up on overdue balances and resolving payment discrepancies quickly. Self-directed and systematic, you manage daily tasks consistently, maintain organized financial records, and provide timely reports that support decision-making and healthy cash flow management.



Job Responsibilities

Maintain and update the Customer Balance Sheet to ensure all invoices and amounts are fully recorded, providing accurate and up-to-date financial data for each client.

Distribute invoices and current balance summaries daily via clients' individual Slack channels upon receipt of files, ensuring invoice numbers and amounts are correct to avoid discrepancies.

Upload daily financial files (invoice PDFs and order-detail Excel files) to clients' Google Drives, ensuring records are complete, organized, and accessible at all times.

Record client payment proofs under the designated payment proof tab, maintaining a clear audit trail for all transactions and tracking those that have been pending for too long.

Monitor and record payments received through Payoneer, accurately allocating transactions to each client's individual tab.

Support payment issue resolution by requesting and verifying payment documentation (PDFs) from clients when required.

Track overdue balances and proactively follow up on long-outstanding amounts to support timely collections and healthy cash flow.

Provide end-of-week balance updates for clients with high outstanding balances to ensure visibility and prompt action.

Prepare and send financial reports twice weekly in the #Finance channel, including Payoneer Balance Summaries and a list of clients with the highest unpaid invoices.

Assist in resolving and escalating client finance-related concerns raised in individual client finance channels to ensure timely resolution and strong client relationships.



Qualification

Educational and Experience

Associate's or Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field preferred.

1-3 years of experience in accounting, accounts receivable, billing, or client finance roles.

Experience with invoice processing and payment tracking.

Familiarity with payment platforms (Payoneer, PayPal, Stripe, or similar).

Background in client-facing finance or billing support preferred.

Experience using Google Drive, Slack, or similar collaboration tools.



Skills & Competencies:

Strong attention to detail with high level of accuracy in data entry and record-keeping.

Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets including formulas, pivot tables, and data organization.

Excellent organizational skills with ability to manage multiple client accounts simultaneously.

Strong written communication skills for professional client interactions via Slack and
.

Understanding of basic accounting principles and accounts receivable processes.

Experience with payment platforms and transaction reconciliation.

Time management abilities to handle daily tasks and meet reporting deadlines.

Problem-solving skills to identify and resolve payment discrepancies.

Customer service orientation with professional and courteous demeanor.

Ability to work independently and follow established procedures consistently.

File management and documentation organization skills.

Proactive approach to collections and follow-up on overdue accounts.

Reliability and consistency in maintaining daily workflows.

Basic knowledge of invoice processing and financial documentation.

title: Experienced Travel advisor and VA
description:
Travel Advisor & Administrative Operations Specialist

Remote | Part-Time or Full-Time

We are a boutique luxury travel company specializing in curated vacation rentals and villas, along with many other types of travel experiences worldwide.



We are currently looking for an experienced Travel Advisor & Administrative Operations Specialist to join our growing team. This role supports client inquiries, trip coordination, and operational workflows in a highly detail-driven environment where thoughtful planning and polished communication are essential.



Our clients expect seamless execution and elevated service from inquiry to return, and we are looking for someone who takes pride in delivering that level of support both behind the scenes and in client interactions.



Role Overview

You will serve as both a client-facing support partner and an operational anchor within the team, helping manage inquiries, organize travel details, coordinate with suppliers, and ensure each trip flows smoothly through our systems.

This is a highly client-interactive role. You will be communicating directly with travelers, guiding them through options, answering questions, and helping move trips from inquiry to confirmed booking.



This role is best suited for someone who already understands the pace, terminology, and expectations of the travel industry and can step in with minimal training while contributing confidently from the start.



Key Responsibilities

Responsibilities include responding to new travel inquiries and gathering intake details. You will assist with planning vacation rentals, villas, cruises, and traditional travel experiences. This includes researching destinations, accommodations, and experiences using supplier networks and destination management company resources.



You will build and format quotes and itineraries, communicate recommendations clearly to clients, and track traveler preferences, budgets, and trip requirements.



The role also includes coordinating with global suppliers such as hotels, villa partners, cruise lines, and DMCs to confirm availability, rates, amenities, and booking terms. You will manage follow-ups, holds, and supplier communications while ensuring all details are documented accurately.



Administrative responsibilities include maintaining CRM records, tracking trip stages and payments, organizing contracts and confirmations, managing inbox communications, supporting workflow checklists, and assisting with calendar coordination and scheduling.



Sales and Client Engagement Component

While this is not a high-pressure sales role, it does require comfort with consultative selling and client-facing communication.

We do not engage in cold sales or outbound prospecting. All client interactions are inquiry-based, meaning you will be responding to travelers who have already expressed interest in planning a trip.

You will communicate directly with clients via
 and occasionally phone or video, guide travelers through options, answer questions, address hesitations, and help move inquiries toward booking decisions. You should feel comfortable discussing pricing, value, and travel experiences while supporting quote revisions and follow-ups.



The ideal candidate is comfortable picking up the reins in client conversations and helping bring trips to confirmation through trust, knowledge, and responsiveness.



Required Experience

Candidates must have four to five years or more experience in the travel industry. Hands-on experience planning or supporting international travel is required.

You should have experience working with vacation rentals, villas, hotels, cruises, or packaged travel. A background in customer service and client-facing communication is essential, along with administrative or operational support experience and strong written communication skills.



This is not an entry-level role. Candidates must have prior travel industry experience(3+ years) and the ability to operate independently within established workflows. We are looking for someone who can step in and contribute without requiring extensive foundational training.



Ideal backgrounds include prior work within a travel agency, tour operator, villa or vacation rental company, luxury travel planning environment, destination management company, or cruise or hospitality booking organization.



Communication Requirements

Candidates must be fluent in spoken and written English and comfortable speaking directly with clients. Communication should feel polished, professional, and aligned with a luxury service environment. Strong clarity in written
s and itinerary presentations is required.



Ideal Candidate Traits

The ideal candidate is highly detail-oriented, organized, and process-driven. You should be comfortable managing multiple trips simultaneously and confident in client-facing conversations. Strong problem-solving ability, follow-through, and accountability are essential, along with comfort working remotely and independently.

Preferred but Not Required



Experience working with luxury or high-net-worth clients is a plus. Familiarity with curated or bespoke travel planning is valuable. Marketing exposure, lead generation experience, Canva or itinerary design skills, and CRM or project management system experience are also beneficial but not required.



Work Structure

This is a remote position. Daytime availability aligned with EST is preferred. The role may be structured as part-time or full-time depending on experience and fit, with long-term opportunity for the right candidate.must have complete setup to work remotely--computer, wifi,backup generator etc

title: Virtual Assistant (Bilingual: Spanish & English)
description:
Dominguez Insurance Services is a U.S.-based Medicare-focused insurance office in California seeking a reliable, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant who is fluent in Spanish and English to support Medicare client communication, appointment setting, and administrative tasks.



This role is ideal for someone who is highly responsive during scheduled work hours, comfortable on the phone, and looking for a long-term opportunity with growth and pay increases based on performance.



Fluent Spanish (spoken and understood) is required, as this role regularly supports Spanish-speaking Medicare clients.



Schedule & Pay

- Part-time to start: 20 hours per week

- Schedule: Monday–Friday, 12:00 PM – 5:00 PM Pacific Time

- Opportunity to move to full-time based on performance

- Pay: $5.00 – $7.50 per hour to start

- Raises and additional hours available based on reliability, experience, and results

Note: Applicants must be consistently available and responsive during scheduled work hours.



Key Responsibilities

- Handle inbound and outbound customer service calls in English and Spanish for Medicare clients

- Serve as a receptionist by answering and routing calls professionally

- Schedule Medicare appointments for insurance agents

- Make welcome calls to new Medicare beneficiaries

- Communicate clearly with clients regarding basic Medicare plan-related questions

- Collect prescription and doctor information for Medicare plan reviews

- Accurately update Medicare client records and profiles

- Follow up with Medicare leads via calls and messages

- Perform administrative tasks including data entry, record updates, and organization

- Follow documented SOPs and training materials to ensure accuracy and compliance



Training & Support

- Clear Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) provided

title: Creative AI Video Editor for Meta & YT Ads
description:
Are you an editor who understands Retention, AI, and Direct Response Marketing?



We are a fast-growing e-commerce company launching multiple brands in the Footwear & Supplement niches. We are looking for a Full-Time (36h/week) Video Editor who is obsessed with AI and creating winning ads for Meta 
/Instagram) and YouTube.



This is NOT a standard editing job. We don’t just hand you footage and say "edit this." We need a Creative Partner who can source clips, generate AI visuals, and build high-converting video ads from scratch.





THE ROLE:



Create High-Retention Ads: You edit fast-paced ads (Short Form & Long Form). You understand that the hook is everything and scenes must change every 2-3 seconds to keep retention high.



AI Asset Generation: You use tools like Midjourney, Runway, or Pika to create realistic B-roll and characters when stock footage isn't enough.



Strategic Sourcing: You are an expert at finding the right B-roll from stock sites, social media (TikTok/Pinterest research), and competitor analysis.



AI Scripting & Audio: You take winning competitor angles and use AI (ChatGPT/Claude) to rewrite them into unique scripts. You then generate voiceovers using ElevenLabs.



Platform: You work primarily in CapCut for speed, effects, and auto-captions.





YOU ARE THE PERFECT FIT IF:



YOU represent the "New Wave" of editors: You don't just cut video; you use AI to create video.

YOU understand Marketing: You know the difference between a "pretty video" and a "video that sells."

YOU are a Problem Solver: Missing a clip? You don't ask us; you generate it with AI or find it online.





OFFER:

Full-Time Position: 36 hours per week

Salary: $1250 per month





HOW TO APPLY:



Read the questions below carefully. To verify you’ve read this full post, please start your application subject line with: "AI-MASTER".



1. Our goal is high retention. What is your specific technique to keep viewers watching past the first 3 seconds?



2. Which Generative AI tools (video/image) are your favorites to use right now and why? Please describe your process for creating a clip from scratch.



3. If we give you a script about "Hiking Shoes" but provide ZERO footage, how would you create the video? Walk us through your sourcing process.



4. Please send your portfolio with 2-3 examples of Ads you have created (preferably with AI elements or high-paced editing).



5. This is a full-time role (36h/week). Are you currently available for this workload?

title: Multimedia Marketing Specialist (Remote)
description:
???? Multimedia Marketing Specialist (Remote – Full-Time)



Own the Creative Storytelling and Digital Growth of Property Rush



Be the force behind our video content, podcast production, presentation assets, social platform ownership and digital advertising execution.



Are you a high-level creative who thrives on pacing, platform algorithms, and clean execution? Do you love taking raw footage and turning it into engaging content that not only looks great — but also performs according to the latest digital ad standards?



Property Rush is a U.S.-based real estate investment and property management company. We’re hiring a Multimedia Marketing Specialist (Remote) to help us dominate our digital presence and ensure our marketing operations stay organized, consistent, and data-driven.



This is a high-ownership role for a specialist who understands the “why” behind the “what” in digital marketing — and takes pride in polished output.

________________________________________



???? Why You’ll Love This Role

• Creative + Strategic Ownership: We film — you create, package, distribute, and optimize.

• Build With Us: We have structured tools in place, and we’re actively tightening our processes — you’ll play a key role in making them better.

• Stability: Long-term remote role with a supportive, systems-driven team.

• High Impact: Your edits and ad management directly drive attention, leads, and performance.

• Growth: Gain hands-on experience with U.S. real estate and grow in responsibility as the portfolio scales.

________________________________________



???? What You’ll Do

20% – BIG ROCKS (Core Creative + Ads Ownership)

? Omni-Channel Content Creation (Short-Form First)

• Edit raw footage into high-performing Reels, TikToks, Shorts, and platform-native feed content

• Tailor content for FB, IG, TikTok, X, and other interactive platforms (format, pacing, captions, trends)

• Create multiple versions of the same content (different openings and lengths) optimized for each platform (different hooks, cut-downs, 9:16 / 1:1 / 16:9)

? Podcast & Long-Form Production (Packaging Thought Leadership)

• Support post-production for planned podcasts (clean edits, pacing, polishing)

• Identify “golden nugget” 
nts and turn them into short-form clips

• Create content packs around each episode (clips + quote/takeaway posts + thumbnails)

? Presentation & Slide Design

• Create professional slide decks and visual presentations for podcasts, webinars, and internal use

• Build simple on-brand templates so recurring decks look consistent and high-end

• Turn outlines into clean, structured slides (frameworks, takeaways, simple visuals)

? Ad Strategy & Execution (Google Ads + Social)

• Apply working knowledge of Google Ads and platform algorithms to support campaigns

• Improve ad performance through creative testing (new hooks, new angles, new cuts)

• Help package ad-ready creatives (hooks, headlines, thumbnails, captions, variations)

? Brand Standards (S.I.G.)

• Ensure all content reflects Property Rush values: stewardship, integrity, and growth (S.I.G.)

• Maintain consistent visual quality and brand voice across channels

________________________________________



80% – DAILY & WEEKLY EXECUTION

• Pipeline Management: Receive raw footage and turn around polished edits on schedule (drafts ? revisions ? finals)

• Platform Management: Post/schedule content across FB/IG/TikTok/X and monitor performance

• Engagement Support: Monitor comments/messages and respond or escalate using guidelines

• Visual Asset Creation: Build slide decks/presentation materials based on BJ’s outlines or topics

• Ad + Algorithm Monitoring: Track performance signals and suggest adjustments to hooks, pacing, angle, and format

• Digital Organization: Keep all creative files, photos, b-roll, ad creatives, and podcast assets organized and audit-ready

• Proactive Reporting: Provide weekly updates on content output, performance trends, and ad creative health

________________________________________



? You’re a Fit If You…

• Have 3+ years experience in social media management and high-end video editing

• Are a “Specialist” or “Craftsman” who takes pride in precision, follow-through, and accuracy

• Are proficient in video tools (CapCut, Premiere Pro, Final Cut, DaVinci, etc.)

• Are comfortable creating slide decks using Canva / Google Slides / PowerPoint / Keynote

• Have working knowledge of Google Ads concepts and platform trends (TikTok/Reels/X)

• Understand performance basics: hook, retention, watch time, CTR, creative fatigue, iteration

• Are highly organized, detail-oriented, and reliable 

• can manage multiple platforms, take ownership and follow through without micromanagement

• Communicate clearly and professionally in English

• Can share a portfolio of short-form edits and/or pages you’ve managed (required)



? Bonus Points: Experience with Meta Ads Manager, graphic design (Canva), YouTube Shorts strategy, light copywriting, content scheduling tools, and familiarity with podcast workflows or real estate marketing

________________________________________



???? Perks & Highlights

• Remote role with consistent work and steady content volume

• Clear priorities, direct feedback, and structured tools to support execution

• Reliable, on-time payments with the opportunity for rate increases based on performance

• Performance incentives tied to quality and KPIs (when applicable)

• Long-term opportunity for the right person as the brand scales________________________________________



???? Why Join Property Rush?

Property Rush is built on stewardship, integrity, and growth (S.I.G.). We believe strong marketing comes from clear ownership, calm communication, and consistent follow-through. If you’re looking for a role where your creative reliability is valued and your work truly matters—you’ll feel at home here. 



???? Apply now and help our brand stand out—and perform. 

________________________________________



As part of our pre-screening process, we kindly ask you to complete both the Culture Index and Personality Assessment provided below. Completing these is required to move to the next stage. Only applicants who completed the assessments will be processed.

• Culture Index Assessment ???? 

• Personality Assessment ????

title: Product Lister for Shopify & Google Shopping
description:
We run several fast-growing dropshipping stores.

We’re looking for someone to take full ownership of the frontend operations product feeds, listings, compliance, pricing accuracy, product research, and close collaboration with the ad team.

This is a unique, career-changing opportunity to help build and scale stores with huge growth potential.

title: Property Operations Virtual Assistant – Temporary Accommodation
description:
Property Operations Virtual Assistant – Temporary Accommodation (Remote)



Location: Remote

Hours: Part-time, 25–30 hours per week (initially)

Rate: Competitive, based on experience

Start Date: Immediate



About Us



We are a fast-growing UK-based property business specialising in Temporary Accommodation. We work closely with local councils, housing associations, and support services to provide safe, well-managed homes for vulnerable individuals and families.



With an expanding portfolio of properties and partnerships, we are looking for a highly organised and proactive Virtual Assistant to support the day-to-day operations of the business.



The Role



This is a key support position within our team. You will help manage tenants, contractors, councils, and compliance processes, ensuring our properties run smoothly and our residents receive excellent service.



The role is fully remote and ideal for someone with strong administrative experience, particularly within property, lettings, housing, or facilities management.

Support with invoices and payment tracking



General Operations Support

Update CRM systems and task management tools



Order furniture and household essentials when required



Carry out online research for suppliers or new partnerships



What We’re Looking For



Essential Skills & Experience



Previous experience in property, lettings, housing, or administration



Excellent written and spoken English



Strong organisational and time-management skills



Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities



Confident communicator with tenants, councils, and contractors

Desirable (Not Essential)



Experience working with local authorities or social housing



Understanding of property compliance requirements



Familiarity with CRMs such as Podio, 
, or Notion



Why Join Us?



Fully remote and flexible working



Purpose-driven role supporting vulnerable people



Opportunity to grow with a scaling business

Long-term career potential

Please send your CV and a short cover letter explaining why you are a good fit for this role to:

“VA Application – Temporary Accommodation”

title: Recruiter
description:
We’re seeking a high-energy, resourceful, and self-motivated Recruiter who can keep pace with a fast-moving organization. This isn’t your typical recruiter role — we’re looking for a proactive talent strategist who can fill diverse seat types (from agents to support and specialized roles), drive full-cycle recruitment, and operate independently with confidence.



A strong plus for this role is experience hiring finance and accounting positions (e.g., bookkeepers, accountants, controllers) and comfortable operating across two LLCs, providing recruitment support for both depending on workload and business priorities. You should also be comfortable recruiting for multiple roles simultaneously, often across different functions and timelines.



What You’ll Be Doing

As a Recruiter, you’ll play a key role in shaping our workforce by identifying, engaging, and hiring exceptional talent across multiple functions. You’ll collaborate closely with HR, Operations, and key stakeholders to ensure that every hire aligns with our culture and performance standards.



Your Core Responsibilities

- Lead the end-to-end recruitment process for all seat types — from sourcing and screening to offer acceptance and onboarding.

- Craft job descriptions and job ads that attract the right candidates and accurately reflect role requirements.

- Proactively source talent across LinkedIn, job boards, referrals, and social platforms.

- Manage and update candidate pipelines through our ATS with precision and accuracy.

- Conduct screening interviews and assess candidates for skill set, culture fit, and growth potential.

- Hire confidently for finance and accounting roles, including bookkeepers, accountants, and similar functions.

- Recruit for multiple positions concurrently, balancing timelines, priorities, and candidate pipelines.

- Partner with hiring managers to refine job requirements and selection criteria.

- Maintain consistent candidate engagement and timely communication throughout the hiring lifecycle.

- Utilize hiring data to refine sourcing strategies and shorten time-to-fill.

- Provide market insights to support long-term talent planning.

- Operate seamlessly across two LLCs, ensuring hiring pipelines are managed efficiently for both.

- Contribute ideas for improving recruitment processes and campaigns to attract niche and passive talent.



What You’ll Bring to the Table

- Minimum 4 years’ experience in recruitment, headhunting, or talent acquisition within fast-paced environments.

- Proven ability to hire across multiple functions, including operations, support, finance, and accounting roles.

- Comfortable recruiting for multiple openings at the same time across varied departments.

- Experienced in creating job descriptions, ads, and campaigns that target the right audience.

- Exceptional English proficiency (C2 level) — strong writing and communication skills.

- Skilled in tools like Google Workspace, Slack, and ATS platforms.

- Comfortable working autonomously and supporting two LLCs with shifting priorities.



Your Key Competencies & Attributes

- Proactivity & Self-Motivation: Stays several steps ahead and takes initiative.

- Resourcefulness & Independence: Handles any type of role with confidence.

- Efficiency & Multitasking: Juggles multiple openings and deadlines seamlessly.

- Creativity & Innovation: Thinks outside the box to source and attract top talent.

- Digital Fluency: Navigates systems and platforms with ease.

- Communication Excellence: Builds rapport and trust with candidates and internal stakeholders.

- Data-Driven Mindset: Uses insights to improve hiring outcomes.

- Flexibility & Resilience: Thrives in dynamic and evolving environments.



What’s In It For You

- 100% Remote Work — Recruit from anywhere in the Philippines

- Career Growth — Opportunity to grow within HR & Talent Acquisition

- Competitive Pay — USD $7/hr as an Independent Contractor

- People-Centric Culture — We value collaboration, innovation, and teamwork



Ready to Build the Future of our Company?

If you’re a proactive, resourceful, and tech-savvy recruiter who thrives on independence and impact — we’d love to hear from you.

title: Bookkeeping Assistant with WaveApps Experience
description:
We’re Hiring at The Farm SoHo!



The Farm SoHo is a boutique coworking and event space company based in New York City, known for its warm, rustic spaces and vibrant community. As we grow, we’re looking for a Bookkeeping Assistant to help us stay on top of our finances, keep our records organized, and support the team behind the scenes.



This is a great opportunity for someone with bookkeeping experience who’s excited to work with a fast-paced, hospitality-focused company with an international team.



What You’ll Do:



Record and categorize financial transactions across our business lines (coworking, event spaces, virtual offices)

Reconcile bank, credit card, and payment platform (e.g. Stripe, PayPal) statements

Maintain and organize financial records using WaveApps (A MUST), QuickBooks Online

Assist with monthly reports and tracking revenue/expenses by business category

Monitor accounts receivable and follow up on outstanding invoices

Collaborate with our team for reporting and documentation needs

Ensure accurate documentation for tax and audit preparation



What We’re Looking For:



At least 1–2 years of bookkeeping or accounting experience

Proven experience and strong familiarity with WaveApps (A MUST)

Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills

Good communication skills in English (written and verbal)

Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

Comfortable working remotely and coordinating with a U.S.-based team

Trustworthy and highly discreet with financial information



Nice to Have:



Experience with U.S.-based businesses or hospitality/coworking companies

Knowledge of financial reporting for service-based businesses

Familiarity with tools like QuickBooks, Google Sheets, Excel, and Hubstaff

Background in managing multiple business units or revenue streams



What We Offer:



Competitive salary based on experience

Long-term, stable role with room for growth

Remote work setup with a collaborative international team

Exposure to a dynamic New York-based hospitality and events brand

title: Finance Administrator and Book Keeping

Job Title: Finance Administrator and Book Keeper

About the Role:

We are seeking a meticulous and experienced finance administrator and Bookkeeper to manage our day-to-day financial transactions and records. title: Customer Retention Specialist
description:

title: Personal Brand Content Manager (CEO Branding)
description:
About the Role 

We are looking for a Personal Brand Content Manager to build and manage the personal brand of our CEO, who leads a fast-growing global e-commerce company. 

This role is not about generic social media posting. You will be responsible for turning real business experiences, leadership insights, and e-commerce knowledge into high-quality thought leadership content, primarily for LinkedIn, and secondarily for Instagram and
. 

If you understand storytelling, personal branding, and business content — this role is for you. 

 

Key Responsibilities 

1. Content & Personal Branding 

• Create content in the voice of the CEO (professional, authentic, insightful). 

• Write and publish LinkedIn posts consistently (primary platform). 

• Repurpose content for Instagram &
. 

• Convert raw ideas, voice notes, meetings, or interviews into compelling posts. 

• Develop content around: 

• E-commerce growth & scaling 

    - Amazon, Walmart & DTC insights 

    - Leadership & team management 

    - Founder lessons, failures & wins 

    - Business mindset & decision-making 

 

2. Content Strategy & Planning 

• Build a monthly content calendar aligned with business goals. 

• Identify trending topics in: 

    - E-commerce 

    - Startups 

    - Founder-led businesses 

• Suggest new content formats (carousels, short videos, text posts). 

• Ensure brand consistency across all platforms. 

 

3. Publishing & Optimization 

• Schedule posts at optimal times. 

• Write strong hooks and CTAs. 

• Track engagement and suggest improvements. 

• Collaborate with designers or video editors (if needed). 

 

Required Skills & Experience 

Must-Have 

• 2–4 years experience in content writing / personal branding / social media 

• Strong English writing & storytelling skills 

• Experience managing founder or CEO personal brands (LinkedIn preferred) 

• Understanding of business, startups, or e-commerce 

• Ability to adapt to someone else’s voice and tone 

 

Nice-to-Have (Big Advantage) 

• LinkedIn growth experience 

• Knowledge of Amazon, DTC, or online business 

• Experience with short-form video scripting 

• Familiarity with tools like Notion, Buffer, Hootsuite, Canva 

 

What This Role Is NOT 

? Not a 
 page 

? Not a Canva-only design role 

? Not influencer or lifestyle content 

? Not basic posting without strategy 

 

KPIs & Expectations (First 90 Days) 

• Consistent posting on LinkedIn (minimum 3–5 posts/week) 

• Clear improvement in engagement quality 

• Well-defined CEO content pillars 

• Strong alignment with CEO’s voice and vision 

• Professional, insightful, and authentic content output 

 

Salary Range 

USD $1000–1200 per month 

(Based on experience and quality) 

 

Why Join CBAYEXPRESS 

• Work directly with a global CEO 

• Learn real e-commerce and leadership insights 

• Long-term growth opportunity 

• Stable, professional, and performance-driven culture 

• Exposure to global markets and brands 

 

How to Apply: Please submit

1. Resume 

2. 2–3 examples of personal brand or LinkedIn content you’ve written 

3. A short video explaining why you’re a good fit for CEO personal branding 

 

Final Note 

We are looking for someone who can think, write, and execute at a high level. If you love storytelling, business content, and personal branding—this role will challenge and grow you.

title: International Distribution Development Manager– Beauty / FMCG
description:
Role Overview (IMPORTANT – READ CAREFULLY) 

We are hiring a mid-level International Distribution Development Manager to research, identify, and build a pipeline of country-level distributors for the HERBISHH brand. 



This is a hands-on execution role focused on: 

- Distributor research 

- Outreach 

- Qualification 

- Coordination 

- Supporting negotiations 



This role works closely with the founder and leadership team, who will guide strategy and final deal decisions. 

 

Key Responsibilities 

1. Distributor Research & Pipeline Building 

  - Research and identify potential distributors, importers, and wholesalers country-by-country (Europe, UK, Middle East, etc.). 

  - Build and maintain structured distributor databases (Excel / CRM). 

  - Shortlist distributors based on predefined qualification criteria. 

2. Outreach & Relationship Development 

  - Initiate outbound communication via
, LinkedIn, and calls. 

  - Introduce the HERBISHH brand to potential distributors professionally. 

  - Schedule and coordinate introductory meetings. 

  - Manage follow-ups and maintain active communication. 

3. Distributor Qualification 

  - Evaluate distributors on Market coverage, Channel focus (retail, salon, pharmacy, ethnic stores), & Import capability 

4. Warehousing & sales capability 

  - Collect required information for internal evaluation. 

  - Commercial & Coordination Support 

  - Coordinate product samples, pricing information, and documentation. 

  - Support commercial discussions under guidance from leadership. 

  - Assist in preparing distributor proposals and onboarding documentation. 

5. Internal Coordination 

  - Work with internal teams (regulatory, logistics, finance) to support distributor onboarding. 

  - Track distributor conversations, feedback, and progress. 

 

Experience & Skills Required 

- Must have 3–6 years of experience in international sales, Export business, distributor/channel sales, B2B partnerships 

- Exposure to working with distributors, importers, or wholesalers 

- Strong research, communication, and follow-up skills 

- Comfortable with outbound outreach and cold conversations 

- Ability to work independently with clear guidance 

- Good Excel / reporting skills 



Preferred (Not Mandatory) 

- FMCG, beauty, cosmetics, personal care, or pharma experience 

- Exposure to USA, Europe, UK, or Middle East markets 

- Experience supporting distributor onboarding or export documentation 

 

Education 

  - Bachelor’s degree in Business, International Trade, Marketing, or related field 

  - MBA preferred but not required 

 

Compensation 

  - Base Salary: (depending on experience) 

  - Performance Incentives: Based on distributor onboarding and revenue milestones 

  - Clear growth path to Senior International Distribution Manager 

 

Why Join Us 

  - Opportunity to build an international distribution channel from the ground up 

  - Direct exposure to global markets and leadership decision-making 

  - High ownership and learning 

  - Strong career progression as the channel scale

title: Chief Operating Officer (COO) / Integrator
description:
Position: COO / Integrator (Second-in-Command)



Department: Executive Operations

Reports to: CEO & Director

Employment Type: Full-time



About CBAYEXPRESS / Herbishh

CBAYEXPRESS CORPORATION is a Canadian-based e-commerce company with multi-market presence across Amazon (US, CA, MX, UK, EU, AU, SG, IN, UAE), Walmart, Shopify (
, 
), eBay, Etsy, and more.

Our flagship brand Herbishh leads in hair care & personal care, with revenues exceeding CAD 15M annually, and we are scaling rapidly towards CAD 20M+ in global sales.



With 40+ employees across Canada, India, and the Philippines, we are now hiring a COO/Integrator to streamline operations, enforce accountability, and scale the company to its next phase of growth.



Role Overview

The COO will act as the Integrator (EOS model) and second-in-command to the CEO, ensuring that vision translates into execution. They will oversee cross-functional teams (Amazon, Shopify/D2C, Inventory, Finance, HR, Regulatory, and Customer Success) and enforce SOPs, KPIs, and operational discipline.



This is a hands-on leadership role, ideal for someone who has scaled an e-commerce business from $10M ? $30M+ and knows how to align global teams across multiple marketplaces.



Key Responsibilities

1. Leadership & Alignment

• Translate CEO’s vision into executable quarterly/annual plans.

• Manage and mentor Department Heads (Amazon, D2C, Inventory, Finance, Marketing, HR).

• Run weekly leadership meetings with clear scorecards, KPIs, and accountability.

2. Operational Excellence

• Build, enforce, and update SOPs across all departments (Amazon, Shopify, Finance, HR, Regulatory).

• Drive operational efficiency across Canada, India, PH, and Mexico teams.

• Ensure smooth coordination between product sourcing (India/China) and sales (Amazon, Shopify, Walmart).

3. Financial & Performance Management

• Partner with CFO/CPA and Finance team to ensure P&L discipline.

• Monitor gross margins, TACOS, working capital, and inventory health.

• Set quarterly KPIs for each department and ensure consistent reporting.

4. Growth Enablement

• Support 3PL expansion in Ontario (logistics arm).

• Drive marketplace expansion (Mexico, UAE, AU).

• Ensure regulatory compliance (MOCRA, Health Canada, EU/UK SCPN, etc.) is built into launches.

5. People Management

• Oversee HR Managers to ensure global alignment.

• Resolve cross-team conflicts, restructure roles where needed.

• Build leadership pipeline for scaling to 60+ employees.



Requirements

• 7–10 years in e-commerce / D2C / Amazon-native operations.

• Proven track record of scaling business from $10M ? $30M+ revenue.

• Strong background in Amazon FBA ops, multi-country marketplaces, and supply chain.

• Experience managing 40+ person distributed teams.

• Hands-on with KPIs, dashboards, SOP creation, and process automation.

• Excellent communicator, able to align India, PH, Canada, and Mexico teams.



Nice-to-Have

• Exposure to beauty/personal care categories.

• Experience in Shopify CRO / D2C growth.

• Familiarity with financial reporting, CAC/LTV metrics, and tax compliance.

• EOS/Traction framework experience (Integrator role).



What We Offer

• Competitive salary (based on experience)

• Opportunity to be the #2 in a rapidly scaling global e-commerce brand.

• Direct mentorship from CEO.

• Career progression to Global COO / President role as business expands to retail & 3PL.

• Work with a multicultural team across 4 continents.

title: Amazon Operations & Compliance Manager
description:
Position: Amazon Operations & Compliance Manager



Department: Amazon Global Operations

Location: Remote Work

Shift Timings: EST Time Zone



About CBAYEXPRESS / Herbishh

CBAYEXPRESS CORPORATION is a Canadian-based e-commerce company with $15M+ annual revenue, selling across Amazon (US, CA, MX, UK, EU, AU, SG, IN, UAE), Walmart, Shopify, and other marketplaces.



Our flagship brand Herbishh is a leader in haircare and personal care, with aggressive expansion in global markets. Amazon is our primary growth channel, and smooth operations are critical for scaling.



Role Overview

The Amazon Operations & Compliance Manager will oversee all day-to-day operational and compliance activities in Amazon Seller Central across multiple marketplaces. This role ensures that listings remain active, compliant, and optimized, while also managing reimbursements, case resolutions, and policy adherence.



This position will free up Brand Managers to focus on growth and strategy, while ensuring Amazon operations run seamlessly in the background.



Key Responsibilities

1. Listing & Catalog Management

   - Manage all Amazon listing operations: flat file uploads, parent-child variations, attribute updates.

   - Monitor and resolve suppressed, stranded, and inactive ASINs daily.

   - Maintain brand registry submissions and ensure consistency across marketplaces.

2. Compliance & Policy Management

   - Monitor and address compliance issues (keywords, claims, DG/Hazmat flags).

   - Work closely with Regulatory Affairs team (Senior Manager, Arunima, Sohel) to submit required documents (SDS, COA, HRIPT, etc.).

   - Proactively prevent suspensions and policy violations.

3. Reimbursements & Cost Recovery

   - File and track FBA reimbursement claims for lost/damaged inventory and fee overcharges.

   - Audit discrepancies in shipments and ensure compensation.

   - Use tools like Helium10 Refund Genie, Sellerboard, or manual audits.

4. Case & Issue Management

   - Own the Amazon case log – raise, escalate, and resolve support tickets.

   - Track response times and push for faster resolutions.

   - Maintain an issue tracker with clear visibility for Brand Managers and leadership.

5. Cross-Functional Coordination

   - Work with Inventory team on shipment reconciliation.

   - Support PPC Managers by ensuring listings remain ad-eligible.

   - Assist Brand Managers in smooth product launches by handling back-end uploads and approvals.



KPIs / Success Metrics

   - % of listings active with zero suppression/inactivity.

   - Value of reimbursements recovered from Amazon (target: $50K–100K+ annually).

   - Average resolution time for Amazon cases.

   - Zero major account suspensions or policy violations.

   - On-time support for new product launches.



Requirements

   - 3–5 years experience in Amazon Seller Central operations & compliance.

   - Strong knowledge of flat files, brand registry, listing troubleshooting.

   - Experience filing and tracking reimbursements (Helium10/Sellerboard preferred).

   - Excellent organizational skills & attention to detail.

   - Ability to manage multiple marketplaces (US, CA, MX, UK, EU, AU).

   - Strong communication skills for Amazon case escalations.



Nice-to-Have

   - Experience with Walmart Seller Center operations.

   - Familiarity with e-commerce compliance workflows (SDS, COA, DG).

   - Worked with $10M+ Amazon accounts previously.



What We Offer

   - Competitive salary

   - Opportunity to manage operations for a multi-million-dollar Amazon account.

   - Direct impact on business profitability via reimbursements & issue prevention.

   - Growth path to Senior Amazon Operations Manager as team expands.

title: Shopify CRO / D2C Growth Manager
description:
Position: Shopify CRO / D2C Growth Manager 



Department: Marketing & D2C 

Location: Philippines

Shift Timings: EST Time Zone with Time Tracker



About CBAYEXPRESS / Herbishh 

CBAYEXPRESS CORPORATION is a Canadian-based e-commerce company with multi-market presence across Amazon, Walmart, Shopify, eBay, and international marketplaces. Our flagship brand Herbishh specializes in hair care and personal care, scaling rapidly across global channels. 



We are now building a dedicated D2C team to grow Shopify into a major revenue channel. 



Role Overview 

The Shopify CRO / D2C Growth Manager will own the Shopify channel growth, focusing on conversion rate optimization (CRO), AOV growth, retention, and customer lifetime value. This person will act as the bridge between marketing, creative, and customer experience to maximize the performance of our D2C stores. 



Key Responsibilities 

1. Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) 

• Audit our website - Herbishh and future brand sites. 

• Run A/B tests across PDPs, landing pages, cart, and checkout. 

• Optimize UX, speed, and mobile-first experience. 

• Implement upsell, cross-sell, and bundle strategies. 



2. D2C Sales Growth 

• Own the Shopify P&L (traffic/conversion/retention). 

• Collaborate with Dhruvi (Head of Marketing) on paid media alignment. 

• Ensure all ad-driven traffic lands on CRO-optimized pages. 



3. Customer Journey & Retention 

• Work with
/CRM Manager to improve flows (welcome, post-purchase, win-back, subscription). 

• Increase AOV (bundles, upsells) and LTV (subscriptions, loyalty programs). 

• Collaborate with Marketing Manager for omnichannel integration. 



4. Data & Analytics 

• Monitor KPIs: conversion rate, AOV, LTV, CAC. 

• Use attribution & analytics tools (GA4, Triple Whale, Northbeam). 

• Build weekly D2C performance dashboards for leadership. 



5. Collaboration & Execution 

• Coordinate with creative team for CRO-focused assets (infographics, landing pages). 

• Gather customer insights from Customer Success team for CRO experiments. 

• Partner with inventory & product teams to align D2C launches with Amazon. 



Requirements 

• 3–5 years in Shopify CRO / D2C growth role. 

• Proven track record of increasing conversion rates & AOV. 

• Hands-on experience with CRO tools (Hotjar, VWO, Google Optimize, Optimizely). 

• Familiarity with Shopify apps (Rebuy, Bold Bundles, Zipify, Recharge). 

• Strong analytical skills (GA4, Triple Whale, Looker, or similar). 

• Excellent communication & project management skills. 



Nice-to-Have 

• Experience with beauty/personal care brands. 

• Knowledge of Meta, Google, TikTok Ads funnel optimization. 

• Exposure to subscription/retention growth strategies. 



What We Offer:

• Competitive salary (depending on experience). 

• Direct exposure to leadership & decision-making. 

• Opportunity to shape analytics foundation of a global brand. 

• Growth path into Head of Analytics / Business Intelligence Director role. 

• Collaborative remote-first culture with global teams (India, PH, Canada, Mexico).

title: Online English Teachers (Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, catering to individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced Near-Native English-speaking Online K-12 Math and/or Science Teachers with verifiable teaching certifications. The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.



Responsibilities



Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Must hold a valid teaching license/certification (e.g., Teaching License, State Certification). TESOL/TEFL is a plus.

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

title: Life Manager (Executive Assistant) - Remote Full Time
description:
Hello, we are looking to hire a life manager to support our agency and founder with the agency’s day-to-day operations



This is not a personal assistant role and not a traditional executive assistant role



You will help design, manage, and run systems across both work and personal life so everything operates smoothly, predictably, and with minimal mental overhead



The goal is not just to complete tasks, but to reduce decision fatigue, improve organization, and create leverage through systems, structure, and proactive execution





What success looks like in this role?



• Fewer things falling through the cracks

• Clear priorities every day and week

• Tasks and projects move forward without constant reminders

• Life and business logistics feel “handled”

• Less chaos, more clarity



If that sounds exciting to you, this role fits!



Core responsibilities



Daily / Ongoing



• Managing tasks, reminders, and follow-ups

• Keeping systems organized and up to date

• Tracking priorities and deadlines

• Proactively flagging issues or bottlenecks

• Communicating clearly and concisely



Weekly



• Light project management and coordination

• Reviewing open loops and unfinished items

• Improving existing systems and workflows

• Preparing summaries and updates



Ongoing improvement



• Creating structure where there is chaos

• Documenting processes

• Suggesting better tools or workflows

• Learning fast and adapting to new responsibilities





What we care most about (non-negotiables)



• Full-time dedication only

This must be your only professional role. No side jobs, no freelance work, no agencies.



• High loyalty and long-term mindset

We’re looking for someone who wants stability and growth together, not short-term gigs.



• Extreme attention to detail

You notice small things others miss. You double-check. You follow instructions exactly.



• Ownership mentality

You don’t wait to be told what broke. You flag it, fix it, and improve the system



• Always hungry to learn

You enjoy getting better, learning tools, and expanding responsibility





Skills and experience (flexible but important)



• Some project management experience

• Comfortable working with tasks, deadlines, and priorities

• Familiar with tools like Notion, ClickUp, Asana, Trello, Google Docs, or similar

• Strong written English

• Calm under pressure

• Organized and structured by nature



Experience matters less than how you think



Who this role is NOT for (this saves time)



This role is not a fit if:

• You want to juggle multiple jobs

• You only want to execute tasks you’re told

• You dislike structure, systems, or documentation

• You need constant supervision

• You prefer short-term work



Questions:



Question 1:

Are you comfortable working US (EST) time zone?



Question 2:

Why are you specifically looking for a full-time, long-term role instead of multiple clients or freelance work?



Question 3:

Why are you interested in this role specifically?



Question 4:

What previous experience do you have (work or personal) that would make you a good fit for this role?



Question 5:

What tools or systems have you used to stay organized in past roles?





Important:

To apply, start your application message with the word “Structure” on the first line.



Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed



Breakdown Of the Initial Days:



First 30 days:



• Execute tasks accurately

• Learn systems and expectations

• Build trust through consistency



After 60–90 days:



• Proactively manage systems

• Improve workflows

• Take ownership of recurring areas

• Act as a second brain, not just support

title: Remote Millwork Estimator
description:
Job Description: 



We are seeking a Remote Technical Recruiter to join our team and support full-cycle recruiting for technical and specialized roles. The ideal candidate will be responsible for identifying, attracting, and engaging qualified talent while delivering a positive candidate experience. This role requires strong communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple open roles in a fast-paced, fully remote environment while partnering closely with hiring managers.



Key Responsibilities:



Manage the full recruitment lifecycle, including sourcing, screening, interviewing, and coordinating offers for technical and specialized positions.

Partner with hiring managers to understand role requirements, technical skill needs, and team culture.

Source candidates through multiple channels, including job boards, LinkedIn, referrals, and direct outreach.

Conduct initial screening interviews to assess technical qualifications, experience, communication skills, and cultural fit.

Coordinate and schedule interviews between candidates and internal stakeholders.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in the applicant tracking system (ATS).

Provide timely communication and feedback to candidates throughout the hiring process to ensure a positive candidate experience.

Support employer branding efforts and continuously improve recruiting processes and sourcing strategies.



Qualifications & Requirements:



Proficiency in English (verbal and written); 

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in recruiting, HR, or a related field is highly preferred

Resume must be provided in English.

Availability to work full-time on EST (New York time).

Proven experience as a technical recruiter or recruiter supporting technical, IT, or specialized roles (preferred but not required).

Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with candidates and internal stakeholders.

Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple roles and priorities simultaneously.

Experience using ATS platforms and sourcing tools (LinkedIn Recruiter, job boards, etc.) is preferred.

Knowledge of Microsoft Office 365 (Word, Excel, Outlook).

Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and thrive in a remote work environment.

Reliable computer (Windows 10 or newer), two monitors, and stable high-speed internet required.



Compensation & Benefits:

100% remote work

Compensation in USD

Full-time position with 40 hours weekly

Supportive work environment with opportunities for growth and professional developmentJob Summary:



We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Remote Millwork Estimator to support accurate pricing and evaluation of cabinetry, furniture, and architectural millwork projects. This role is responsible for reviewing architectural drawings and specifications, preparing detailed cost estimates for materials, labor, and subcontractor services, and coordinating with external suppliers to obtain accurate pricing. The Millwork Estimator will maintain current knowledge of industry standards, material costs, and labor rates, while identifying assumptions, exclusions, and potential risks within estimates. The ideal candidate brings strong technical expertise in millwork estimating, proficiency with CAD and estimating software, excellent communication and analytical skills, and a clear focus on estimating responsibilities without project management involvement.



Key Responsibilities:



Prepare accurate cost estimates for millwork projects, including materials, labor, and subcontractor expenses.

Review architectural drawings, blueprints, and specifications to define project scope and requirements.

Coordinate with external suppliers for materials such as upholstery, metal, and glass.

Maintain up-to-date knowledge of material pricing, labor rates, and relevant industry standards.

Deliver clear, accurate, and professional estimates to internal teams and clients.

Identify assumptions, exclusions, and potential risks within estimates to support accurate pricing.

Update and maintain estimating databases, templates, and cost libraries for future projects.

Support additional administrative related tasks as assigned.

Qualifications & Requirements:



Strong English communication skills (written and spoken).

Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills.

Proficiency with CAD software and estimating tools.

Ability to read and interpret architectural drawings, blueprints, and project specifications accurately.

Proven experience as a millwork estimator (cabinetry, furniture, architectural millwork).

Strong knowledge of millwork materials, manufacturing processes, and supplier pricing.

Experience coordinating with suppliers for materials such as upholstery, metal, and glass.

Excellent organizational, communication, and analytical skills.

This role is focused exclusively on estimating responsibilities; no project management duties are included.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) and Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets), preferred.

Sound judgment and ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

Reliable computer (Windows 10 or newer), two monitors, and stable high-speed internet.?

Compensation & Benefits:



100% remote work.

Compensation in USD.

Full-time position with 40 hours weekly.

Great work environment with potential for growth.

title: ???? Motion Graphics Video Editor (Ads & Explainers)
description:
Location: Remote

Type: Freelance / Contract (long-term possible)

Industry: SaaS / Marketing Automation / Ads



About the role



We are looking for a skilled Motion Graphics Video Editor to create high-converting advertising videos that explain our software and systems in a clear, visually engaging way.



These videos will be used mainly for paid ads (Meta, Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn).

The focus is motion graphics first — stock footage can be used, but the story and clarity must come from the graphics.



If you love turning complex ideas into clean, compelling visuals, this role is for you.



- What you’ll be creating



Short-form motion-graphics ads (15–45 seconds)



Software explainers (UI flows, benefits, outcomes)



Dynamic text animations, icons, diagrams, transitions



Ads that focus on clarity, emotion and results, not just visuals



Occasionally combining stock footage + motion graphics



- What we’re looking for



Strong experience in motion graphics (not just basic video editing)



Excellent sense of visual storytelling & pacing



Ability to explain software / systems / processes visually



Clean, modern design style (not overcomplicated)



Experience with ads is a big plus



- Tools (one or more):



After Effects (required)



Premiere Pro / DaVinci Resolve / Final Cut (optional)



Figma / Illustrator (plus)



Portfolio requirements (important)



To apply, you must include a portfolio with:



Motion-graphics focused videos



Preferably explainer videos, SaaS videos or ad creatives



Clear examples where motion graphics drive the message



?? Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.

We want to clearly see your quality and style upfront.



- Nice to have



Experience creating ads that convert



Understanding of marketing funnels or SaaS products



Ability to work fast and iterate based on feedback



What we offer



Clear briefs & structured feedback



Long-term collaboration if the fit is right



Creative freedom within a strong strategic framework



Remote work, flexible hours



Fair, consistent pay per project or per video



- How to apply



Send:



A short introduction



Your portfolio or showreel (required)



Your preferred rate (per video or per project)

title: AI VIDEO CREATOR (Instagram & TikTok Reels)
description:
???? AI VIDEO CREATOR WANTED (Instagram & TikTok Reels)

I’m looking for a skilled AI video creator to help me produce short-form educational reels for Instagram and TikTok in the wellness, energy, and consciousness space.

This role is ideal for someone who understands AI-generated video tools, short-form storytelling, and how to communicate educational content in a clear, engaging, and visually compelling way.



? WHAT YOU’LL BE CREATING

title: Virtual Assistant & Website Manager — WordPress/Next.js + Vercel + Stripe
description:
We’re hiring a reliable Virtual Assistant & Website lead to maintain our site hosted on Vercel and manage Stripe payment flows. You’ll combine VA/client-communications skills with hands?on web ops: deploy updates, manage env variables, monitor previews, troubleshoot Stripe checkouts/webhooks, and maintain clear SOPs.



Primary responsibilities



Maintain and update site content and assets on the live site (WordPress or Next.js pages). Implement small content/layout fixes and image updates.

Manage Vercel deployments: create preview deployments, update environment variables, troubleshoot failed builds, and coordinate merges to main.

Configure and troubleshoot Stripe: payment links, Checkout, Billing, webhooks (test & live), handle webhook retries and debugging.

Create simple automations (Zapier/Make) connecting Stripe ? CRM/Google Sheets/QuickBooks.

Respond to client
s and support tickets, triage website/checkout issues, and provide status updates.

Keep documentation/SOPs: deployment steps, rollback procedure, Stripe test checklist, plugin lists.

Coordinate with external developers for complex bugs and keep tasks small and well-documented.

Required experience & skills



2+ years supporting small businesses as a VA or website manager.

Practical experience with Vercel (deployments, environment variables, preview deployments). Familiarity with Git/GitHub branching and merge workflows.

Stripe experience (dashboard, test mode, Checkout, webhooks, payment links).

WordPress OR Next.js experience (state which your site uses). Comfort editing content and applying small layout fixes; basic HTML/CSS.

Strong written English and customer-facing communication.

Familiar with Google Workspace, Slack, and a simple project tracker (Trello/Asana).

Reliable internet and 2–4 hours of overlap with EST preferred.

Nice to have



Experience with serverless functions (Next.js API routes or Vercel serverless functions).

WooCommerce, Zapier/Make, or QuickBooks integration experience.

Basic TypeScript/JavaScript troubleshooting for small fixes.

title: Ecommerce Team Lead (Shopee, Lazada, Tiktok, Bigseller)
description:
URGENT HIRING



Join our team and become part of a dynamic, global organization of 40 professionals across Korea, Singapore, Malaysia, and the Philippines. Collaborate closely with our regional teams to grow an exciting portfolio of leading Korean brands, including Beauty of Joseon, Needly, Tirtir, and other top-trending names in the market.



We are seeking an experienced person who can manage a brand's health independently and turn data into growth strategies; managing seller accounts and tea
mbers.



Key Responsibilities:

- Monitor SOPs for campaign execution, product listing (SEO-optimized), and performance reporting to ensure high-quality output.

- Oversee task progress and execute final quality checks on all pre-launch deliverables, including voucher setups, flash sale nominations, and campaign banners.

- Conduct competitor price analysis and market trends to deliver actionable insights.

- Monitoring of orders, GMV (Sales), campaigns, product listings, prices, promotions for accounts.

- Organize and follow up cases by calling or
ing e-commerce platforms (e.g., Refund/Return disputes, customer complaints, and fraud prevention).

- Track and report on Ad Performance (ROAS/ACOS) and key sales metrics, providing the Senior Team Lead with recommendations.

- Conduct daily team check-ins to review pending tasks, proactively address immediate roadblocks, and ensure team alignment on platform priorities (e.g., campaign launches, inventory checks).

- Other ad-hoc tasks and support to the stakeholders.



Qualifications:

- 4–5 years of experience in E-commerce Account Management or Operations, with deep knowledge of Shopee Seller Centre, Lazada Seller Center, and TikTok Shop.

- Proven experience in a supervisory level managing remote teams.

- Advanced skills in Google sheets and Excel. Managing large datasets, utilizing advanced formulas (e.g., VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables), and generating performance reports.

- Highly organized, able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

- Strong communication skills with the ability to work effectively in multicultural teams.

- Seeking a dedicated full-time and long term role.



Benefits:

- Stable full time employment with leave benefits, up to 14 days annual leave, public holiday leave, birthday leave.

- Travel Opportunity to Singapore based on performance.

- Comfortable work environment, same working time zone as Philippines (GMT +8).

- Structured salary increase and promotion based on performance.



To apply, please answer a few short pre-screening questions via the Google Form linked below. This helps us better understand your background and fit for the role before the interview stage.







We appreciate your interest and look forward to hearing from you!

title: Part Time Graphic Designer (Educational Visuals & Motion)
description:
About the Project

==============

We are building an educational content platform that explains real?world concepts using clear, simple visuals.



We are looking for a part-time remote Graphic Designer who enjoys turning written ideas into clean infographics, diagrams, and simple animations.



This is a long-term role with consistent work — ideal for someone who prefers structured, meaningful design work instead of fast-paced marketing graphics.



You will focus on clarity, structure, and consistency across website, video, and social content.



What You’ll Work On

================



Main Work

---------------

Infographics for website concept pages (core source visuals)

Adapting the same infographic for:

– YouTube videos

– Instagram & LinkedIn posts

Simple charts and explanatory diagrams

Simple animation such as:

– reveal animations

– step-by-step builds

– short explainer clips for reels



How Our Design System Works

--------------------------------------------



Each concept visual is reused across:



Website

YouTube

Short Videos

Social Media



This means:

- Clear design system

- Less redesign work

- More consistent workflow



What This Role Focuses On

=====================

This role focuses on:

Clean layout and spacing

Clear concept explanation

Consistent visual system

Simple, professional animation



This role is not focused on branding, logos, or heavy visual effects — the goal is clarity and education.



Skills & Experience Required

======================

Required

-------------

Strong layout and spacing skills

Ability to simplify complex ideas visually

Experience creating:

– Infographics

– Diagrams

– Charts / explanatory visuals

Comfortable working with design rules and structure

Comfortable adapting one visual across multiple formats



Tools (Any)

- Figma

- Canva (manual design, not AI?only)

- PowerPoint / Keynote (acceptable)



Animation (Basic Required)

- Simple reveal / build animations

- Figma / Canva animation OR basic After Effects



(No advanced motion graphics needed)



Nice To Have

==========

Educational or explainer content experience

Data visualization experience

Experience working with non-designers / subject experts



How We Work

===========

We will provide:

- Written concept explanation

- Clear visual direction

- Defined fonts, colors, and layout system



You will

======

- Design clean visuals

- Suggest simple visual structures

- Adapt visuals across formats (without redesigning)



Time Commitment

===============

15–20 hours per week (ongoing)



Typical workload includes

====================

- Visuals for 2 long videos every 2 weeks

- Visuals for 3–4 short videos per long video

- Website infographic updates



Compensation

===========

- Hourly or per deliverable (based on experience)

- Long-term collaboration preferred



How To Apply

Please share:



-Short introduction about yourself

-2–4 samples showing:

• Infographics

• Diagrams

• Educational / explanatory visuals



(Advertising posters alone are not enough)



- Tools you use

- Weekly availability

title: Operations Assistant for E-Commerce (Shopify)
description:
The Role



Our Product Operations Assistant role will be responsible for managing the process that ensures that our nurse entrepreneurs are able to place their orders on our platform with ease.  Our nurse entrepreneurs need to acquire supplies in order to serve their clients and rely on us to manage the operations of ordering and fulfillment behind the scenes.



In this role, your primary responsibility will be to manage our supplies operations and fulfillment process including:



Register new accounts eligible to use our supplies platform

Monitor our platform for incoming orders and payments

When an order is received through our platform, place that order with the appropriate supplier

Daily reconciliations between our platform orders and the supplier orders

Occasional customer service via
 to ensure lost or incorrectly placed orders are identified and resolved

Escalate any serious issues to your manager

Identify and recommend opportunities to improve the process

Additional ad hoc responsibilities as requested by your manager or the product and engineering team including activities such as manual testing of new product features and data entry.



We’re looking for candidates who:



Have experience working with US customers in a similar role (e.g., e-commerce store management).

Experience working with Shopify (and the likes of it).

Experience with basic data analysis tools like Microsoft Excel.

Are willing to work US hours (as late as 8p ET on weekdays).

Boast strong written and verbal English skills.

Exhibit high attention to detail and reliability.

Can execute tasks efficiently and effectively.



Additional requirements:

Reliable internet connection (>10mbps).

Quiet working environment.

Proficiency in English.



Bonus if:

You have previously worked in a healthcare/beauty/wellness business.

You have experience with project management tools like Asana or Trello.

Experience with QA (Quality Assurance) manual testing



To apply, please use the link below:

https://jobs.ashbyhq.com/Moxie/425e97cf-7bfd-4fc8-8761-7fa9ff7a126e
