title: Inbound Marketing & Funnel Specialist (SEO + Website Focus)
description:
About the Role 



We’re a UK-based experiential catering company looking for one person to help us:

	•	Get more of the right people to our website

	•	Turn visitors into enquiries

	•	Improve how our website converts



We already do £150,000+ per year with no marketing spend.

This role is about helping us grow, not starting from scratch.







What You’ll Be Doing (Day to Day)

	•	Improve our website so it’s clearer and converts better

	•	Help set up simple enquiry funnels

	•	Work on practical SEO (service pages, local search)

	•	Use existing event content to support trust (social proof)

	•	Track where enquiries come from and what works



You won’t be:

	•	Writing blogs all day

	•	Managing social media accounts full-time

	•	Creating ads

	•	Chasing followers







What We’re Looking For



You don’t need to be “senior” — but you do need to understand:

	•	How websites turn visitors into enquiries

	•	How SEO can bring people who are ready to buy

	•	How to explain why something worked or didn’t



If you’ve helped a website get more enquiries, this role fits.







Nice (But Not Essential)

	•	Experience with service-based businesses

	•	Basic SEO or funnel tools

	•	Simple reporting (spreadsheets are fine)







Pay & Upside

	•	Modest hourly base rate

	•	Commission on new jobs won from inbound leads you generate

	•	5–10% of job value (paid after deposit)



We already have revenue without marketing, so improvements here can make a real difference.







How We’ll Work Together

	•	Clear expectations

	•	Simple monthly goals

	•	First month = paid trial with clear tasks

	•	Long-term role for the right person







How to Apply



Please send:

	1.	A short intro in your own words

	2.	One example of how you helped a website get more enquiries

	3.	Tools you’ve used (if any)

	4.	Your hourly rate

	5.	Confirmation you’re open to commission on jobs won



(AI-generated responses won’t be considered - we want to hear from you.)

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
Position: Marketing Specialist

Reports to: CEO, ILX Travel 

Employment Type: Part Time 

Time Zone Requirement: Must have regular working-hour overlap with the U.S. Eastern Time 



About ILX Travel:

ILX Travel is a premier luxury travel concierge company dedicated to designing bespoke travel experiences—resorts, private villas, yacht charters, cultural journeys, cruises, and wellness retreats. As a Virtuoso affiliate, ILX provides exclusive privileges, amenities, and insider access. 



Mission, Vision, Values & Brand Promise 



Mission: 

To design extraordinary, personalized travel experiences that enrich our clients’ lives through discovery, comfort, and authentic connection—delivered with exceptional service, expertise, and care. 

Vision: 

To become the most trusted luxury travel partner for discerning travelers seeking curated journeys, exclusive access, and seamless service. 

Values: 

Excellence • Integrity • Creativity • Client?Centered Service • Collaboration • Innovation • Continuous Improvement 



Brand Promise: 

Effortless luxury, thoughtfully curated. 



Role Purpose:

The Marketing Strategist leads the development, execution, and optimization of ILX Travel’s marketing strategy. This role blends strategic planning, creative brand development, and data?driven decision-making. Ideal candidates must have a deep understanding of the travel and luxury industries, strong marketing leadership, and the ability to guide execution across internal tea
mbers and external partners. 



Key Responsibilities: 

I. Marketing Strategy & Planning 

-Develop and maintain an annual marketing strategy aligned with ILX Travel’s business goals 

-Define target markets, luxury traveler personas, and positioning within the travel industry 

-Identify and prioritize high-impact marketing initiatives 



II. Brand, Messaging & Campaign Direction 

-Lead brand messaging, storytelling, and positioning for ILX Travel 

-Ensure consistent brand voice across website,
, social media, partnerships, and campaigns 

-Plan and oversee multi-channel marketing campaigns 



III. Performance, Data & Optimization 

-Define KPIs and success metrics for marketing initiatives 

-Monitor performance, analyze results, and optimize campaigns for ROI 

-Strengthen CRM workflows and marketing automation (Zoho CRM or similar) 



IV. Cross-Functional & Vendor Leadership 

-Partner with sales teams to convert MQLs. 

-Provide strategic direction to internal contributors, agencies, creators, and vendors 

-Manage marketing budgets and recommend resource allocation 



Required Qualifications: 

1. Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or related field 

2. 5+ years of experience in marketing strategy, preferably within travel, hospitality, luxury services, or premium consumer brands 

3. Experience in leading marketing strategy and decision-making  

4. Strong understanding of digital marketing, SEO/SEM, paid media, and content strategy 

5. Experience working with CRM and marketing automation platforms 

6. Excellent written and verbal communication skills 



Preferred Qualifications: 

1. Prior experience within the travel industry or luxury travel sector 

2. Familiarity with Virtuoso or similar luxury travel networks 

3. Experience managing agencies, partnerships, or influencer collaborations 

4. Ability to travel occasionally. 

5. MBA or advanced degree (optional). 



What Success On This Role Looks Like 

Success in this role is measured by impact, not activity. Within the first 6–12 months, you will have: 

-Built and executed a clear marketing strategy aligned with ILX Travel’s growth goals 

-Established consistent, premium brand messaging across all channels 

-Improved lead quantity, quality and contribution to bookings and revenue 

-Defined and tracked meaningful marketing KPIs with regular reporting 

-Created strong alignment between marketing, sales, and leadership 



What We Offer: 

-Opportunity to lead ILX Travel’s marketing strategy. 

-Flexible work environment. 

-Competitive compensation and benefits. 

-High?level visibility with leadership. 



Application Process:

Please submit your resume, a brief cover letter, and 1–2 examples of marketing campaigns or strategies you’ve led, including performance results where available. Final candidates may be asked to present a high-level 30–60–90 day marketing plan.

title: n8n / Make.com Automation Engineer (Scenario Builds + Error Handling + Documentation) | B2B Agency
description:
Company: FRED.ai (AI automation and agents agency)



About the role



We’re FRED.ai. We build automations and “digital workers” for service businesses to remove admin, speed up lead response, and improve follow-up.



We need an experienced n8n / Make.com Automation Engineer who can build reliable workflows fast, with proper error handling, cost controls, and clean documentation. This is not a “quick hack” role. We want production-ready builds that someone else can maintain.



What you will do (core responsibilities)

1) Build automations in n8n and/or Make.com (module-based)



You will build workflows from a clear brief (inputs, outputs, rules, edge cases). Typical builds include:



Webform or webhook ? validate ? enrich ? HubSpot update ? notify team



Missed call / inquiry ? auto triage ? task creation ? follow-up draft (for approval)



Booking ? confirmations/reminders ? no-show workflows



Quote follow-up nudges ? CRM updates ? reporting outputs



2) Reliability and error handling (non-negotiable)



Every workflow must include:



Retry logic where appropriate



Error routes / fallback paths



Alerts 
/Slack) when a workflow fails



Safe stopping rules (avoid infinite loops)



Clear logs so we can diagnose issues quickly



3) Integration competence



You should be comfortable with:



Webhooks



APIs (REST)



JSON parsing / mapping



Authentication basics (API keys, OAuth where needed)



Connecting common tools (HubSpot, Gmail/Google Sheets, Slack, Calendly, etc.)



4) Documentation and handover discipline



For each module shipped, you must provide:



The exported workflow (n8n JSON) or Make blueprint export



A short Loom walkthrough (5 to 10 minutes)



A simple “How it works” + “How to troubleshoot” note



If it isn’t documented, it isn’t done.



Deliverables (Definition of Done)



A module is only complete when:



Workflow runs successfully end-to-end with test data



Edge cases handled (missing fields, invalid data)



Error handling + alerts implemented



Export file delivered (n8n JSON / Make blueprint)



Loom walkthrough + SOP delivered



Requirements



Must have:



Proven experience building workflows in n8n and/or Make.com



Strong API + webhook experience



Good debugging skills (logs, retries, edge cases)



Clear communication and process discipline



Nice to have:



HubSpot experience (properties, pipelines, lifecycle stages)



Experience building repeatable “templates” for an agency



Basic JavaScript (helpful in n8n)



Working hours and communication



We can start flexible and scale.



Option A (Flexible): 2–4 hours/day, Monday–Friday

Option B (Part-time): 20 hours/week

Option C (Full-time): 40 hours/week (if performance is strong)



Daily update required at the end of your workday:



What you shipped today



Any blockers



What you will do tomorrow



Pay and contract



Start with a paid test task



Then a 2-week trial on hourly or fixed modules



Long-term ongoing work available for strong performers



Please include your expected hourly rate and whether you prefer hourly or fixed-price modules.



Confidentiality (important)



No portfolio use, no sharing screenshots, workflows, client names, or data



No contacting our leads or clients directly



All work is whitelabel and owned by FRED.ai



How to apply (must answer all)



Which platform are you strongest in: n8n or Make.com (or both)?



Share an example of a workflow you built (describe it clearly, no confidential info).



How do you design error handling and alerts?



Have you worked with HubSpot API or HubSpot workflows?



Confirm you can provide exports + Loom + SOP for every module.



Paid test task (required, paid, max 2 hours)



We will pay for this test.



Task: Build a small workflow that:



Receives a webhook



Validates required fields and filters bad inputs



Writes to Google Sheets



Sends a Slack (or
) notification



Includes error handling + failure alerting



Includes loop prevention / safe stopping rules



Deliver:



Export file (n8n JSON or Make blueprint)



Short Loom walkthrough



5 to 10 bullet “How it works / troubleshooting” notes



Top 5 skills (OnlineJobs.ph friendly)



n8n Automation



Make.com (Integromat)



API Integration + Webhooks



JSON parsing / data mapping



Workflow documentation + troubleshooting

title: VA / Researcher (B2B Lead Research + Hiring Signals + List Hygiene) | Apollo + Instantly + Hubspot
description:
Company: FRED.ai (AI automation and agents agency)



About the role



We’re FRED.ai. We help service businesses grow by installing “digital workers” that remove admin and speed up sales follow-up.



We run a signal-based outbound system (not random mass
ing). We need a detail-oriented VA/Researcher to build high-quality B2B lead lists weekly, keep data clean, and follow a strict process.



This is a long-term role if you perform well.



Your main responsibilities

1) Build “signal lists” (most important)



You will find companies that show real buying signals, such as:



Hiring for roles we often replace with automation: scheduler, dispatcher, service coordinator, estimator admin/assistant, compliance admin, customer service coordinator



Growth signals: new branch, new contracts, expansion, more fleet



Pain signals from reviews: slow response, no follow-up, missed calls, slow quotes



You must include evidence links (job post link, review link, or short note).



2) Find decision-makers and contacts (Apollo)



For each company, find 1–2 relevant contacts, such as:



Owner / Founder



General Manager



Operations Manager



Service Manager



Estimator / Head of Sales (depends on trade)



Export the contacts from Apollo and add them to our list template.



3) Clean and format the list for Instantly + HubSpot



Clean the CSV so it imports smoothly



Remove duplicates



Standardise company names, roles, domains, and locations



Tag each record by list type (hiring signal / review pain / growth signal)



4) Maintain list quality



Flag any low-quality data (generic
s, missing domains, wrong geography, irrelevant industries)



Keep a simple tracker of what you built each day and what was delivered



Deliverables (Definition of Done)



Each delivery must include:



A clean CSV in our template



Company + website/domain



Buying signal tag + evidence link



Contact(s) with role +
 (where available)



QA summary: total rows, duplicates removed, missing domains count



If it isn’t clean and import-ready, it isn’t done.



Tools you must be comfortable with



Required:



Apollo (search, filter, export)



Google Sheets / Excel (dedupe, cleanup, formatting)



Web research (LinkedIn, company websites, job boards, reviews)



Nice to have:



Instantly formatting experience



HubSpot import familiarity



Outscraper / review export tools



Working hours and communication



We can start flexible, then stabilise.



Option A (Flexible): 2–4 hours/day, Monday–Friday

Option B (Part-time): 20 hours/week

Option C (Full-time): 40 hours/week (only if you’re a strong performer)



Daily update required (end of your workday):



What you completed today



Any blockers



What you will do tomorrow



Pay and progression



Start with a paid trial week



If you pass, we continue long-term and increase hours/responsibility



Bonuses possible for consistent high-quality list delivery and speed



(We will agree rate based on experience and test results.)



Confidentiality (important)



You may not share our lead lists, processes, screenshots, or client information



You may not contact our leads or clients directly



This is whitelabel work (no portfolio use)



How to apply (must answer all)



What experience do you have building B2B lead lists?



Have you used Apollo? Describe exactly what you did with it.



How do you remove duplicates and keep spreadsheets clean?



Share a sample of a lead list you built before (you can blur/redact sensitive info).



Confirm your internet speed and that you can work with daily updates.



Paid test task (required, paid, max 2 hours)



We will pay for the test task.



Task: Build a list of 50 companies in one trade niche (we will specify) with a clear buying signal.

Requirements:



Clean CSV in our template



Evidence link for the signal



Add 1–2 decision-maker contacts per company where possible



Short QA summary



Pass = long-term role.



Top 5 skills (OLJ-friendly wording)



Lead generation / lead research (B2B)



Apollo lead sourcing



Data entry + data cleaning (Excel/Google Sheets)



Web research + attention to detail



Process-following + daily communication

Rates

Please propose your hourly rate and also a fixed price for:

200 companies list + contacts + QA

500 companies list + contacts + QA

title: Script Writer For YouTube Channels
description:
We are looking for a competent script writer to join our team. Your job will be to write scripts for multiple YouTube channels.



You MUST:

- Understand the basics of storytelling

- Understand that an introduction consists of a hook and a curiosity loop

- Understand Retention (tensions, stakes, payoffs, hooks and curiosity loops)

- Read and write competently in English



We have a full guide on how to create the scripts and you will have full access to Claude.ai PRO. 



By following the standard operating procedures we have created, writing the scripts using Claude should not take longer than 1 to 2 hours.



The rate will be $5 dollars per script. We are looking for at least one script per day, but you can write as many as you want. 



Please provide me with your best piece of written work as an example.

title: Digital Marketing Assistant - Facebook Ads
description:
We’re an eCommerce company based in the US looking to hire a Marketing Assistant to support the execution and day-to-day operations of our paid advertising across multiple platforms like
 and 
. This role focuses on accurately launching and managing ads, maintaining trackers and reports, and handling supporting tasks that keep our ad accounts running smoothly.



You won’t be creating strategy or optimizing performance — your role is to execute launches, updates, and changes cleanly and accurately based on documented processes.



What You’ll Be Doing

Paid Ads Execution & Account Support

- Execute ad launches, updates and duplication across Meta 
) Ads Manager and AppLovin based on documented SOPs. Ensure settings, budgets, creatives, links, and naming conventions are applied accurately.



Reporting & Tracking

Ongoing Marketing Operations

Process-Based Execution

You’re a Great Fit If You

- 1+ year of recent, hands-on experience launching
 ads (confident navigating

- Reliable internet speed and computer (downloading and uploading creative files)

- Extremely detail-oriented and double check your work (budgets are live, mistakes can be costly)

- Able to execute tasks quickly and accurately (can follow instructions exactly without improvising)

- Are reliable and consistent week after week

- Communicate clearly in English and don’t need to be chased (enthusiastic and positive attitude)



What We Offer

- Fully remove, long-term role

- Flexible hours as long as work is completed

- Clear SOPs + Loom videos for every task

- No pressure to “figure things out” — execution > strategy

- Long-term role with growth potential if you want more responsibility



Application

title: Accounts Payable & Spend Operations Specialist
description:
We’re Not Hiring a Bookkeeper. We’re Hiring Someone Who Keeps the Money Flowing.



PLEASE DO NOT REPLY DIRECTLY TO THIS POST. IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO APPLY, FOLLOW THE STEPS AT THE END.)



Pay: Negotiable flat rate per 2-week period (USD), based on experience

Pay Timing: Paid once every 2 weeks · 80 hours per period

Location: Remote (Philippines-based applicants only)

Role Type: Full-time · Long-term

Team Scope: Owns payment accuracy, funding continuity, and billing follow-through across client accounts



Why This Role Exists

In most companies, ads don’t stop because marketing failed.

They stop because payments failed.



At Black Hat Strategy, we run advertising for multiple clients using a proprietary funding system. Clients fund their ad spend in advance, and those funds must be:

Tracked correctly

Applied to the right accounts

Monitored daily

Followed up on before problems occur

When balances run low or payments are flagged, campaigns can pause unexpectedly — often looking like a “performance issue” when it’s actually a finance operations issue.



We’re hiring an Accounts Payable & Spend Operations Specialist to make sure that never happens.



This role exists so:

Ad accounts don’t pause due to preventable billing issues

Clients are notified before funds run out

Payment problems are resolved quickly and documented clearly

The rest of the team can rely on clean, accurate financial execution



This is not bookkeeping.

This is operational accounts payable in a fast-moving environment.



What You’ll Actually Be Doing

You won’t be running ads.

You won’t be doing creative or strategy.

You will be responsible for ensuring ad spend can continue without interruption.



As an Accounts Payable & Spend Operations Specialist, you will:

Monitor account balances inside our proprietary funding system daily

Ensure client funds are applied to the correct advertising accounts

Track spend velocity and identify accounts approaching low balance

Proactively notify clients when funding is running low (clear, professional follow-ups)

Resolve billing and funding issues, including:

Payment source flagged or denied

Funding not applied correctly

Spend halted due to billing status

Coordinate with internal teams to prevent unnecessary campaign pauses

Document every action, update, and resolution clearly in ClickUp

Escalate issues only when required, with clean evidence and context



You are not reacting after things break.

You are preventing downtime before it happens.



What This Role Owns

Daily funding and balance monitoring

Correct allocation of funds to the right accounts

Resolution of billing and payment interruptions

Client communication related to funding status

Clean documentation of every funding event



If spend stops, this role finds out first.

If spend never stops, this role did its job.



This Role Is for Someone Who…

Has experience in accounts payable, billing, finance ops, or payment support

Is highly detail-oriented and comfortable working with numbers all day

Can track multiple accounts without mixing details or missing follow-ups

Communicates clearly and professionally with clients

Is calm, methodical, and reliable under time pressure

Enjoys structured workflows, checklists, and documentation

Understands that small mistakes can cause expensive downtime



Backgrounds that translate well to this role:

Accounts Payable / Billing Specialist

Finance Operations or Reconciliation roles

Payment processing or billing support

High-stakes customer support involving payments or accounts

Operations roles involving daily monitoring and follow-up

Work ethic and precision matter more than ad experience.



This Role Is Not for Someone Who…

Dislikes repetitive monitoring and follow-through

Gets overwhelmed juggling multiple accounts

Avoids client communication

“Wings it” instead of documenting work

Treats details as optional



How You’ll Work With the Team

Media Buyers manage performance — you ensure money never blocks them

Project Manager tracks execution — you keep funding tasks visible and on time

Escalation & Recovery Lead handles deeper issues — you provide clean billing evidence

Ops Head sets standards — you enforce funding discipline



You are not a background admin role.

You are a critical safeguard in the system.



Why You’ll Like Working Here

Clear ownership and responsibility

Systems-first operations (no chaos, no guessing)

A role where accuracy actually matters

Respect for dependable, detail-driven work

Long-term stability in a growing organization



We don’t reward panic.

We reward preparedness and follow-through.



Application Process

PLEASE DO NOT JUST REPLY TO THIS POST ON THE JOB BOARD.



To be considered, you must complete ALL STEPS BELOW.

The Google Form is your Online Interview.



Step 1: Take a short online IQ test



We respect intelligence and we think you probably do too.

Go to the Fast Learner Free IQ Test and complete it

Create a free account at the end

Save the results URL for Step 3

?? Applicants without a valid link will not be considered



Step 2: Record a 2–3 minute Loom video (camera ON)



Create a free account at Loom

Speak clearly in English

Tell us:

Your paid media experience

How you think about optimization and ROAS

How you’ve helped others improve performance

Save the Loom URL for Step 3



Step 3: Complete the Online Interview



NO AI ALLOWED. We want to hear you.

Open the Application Form

Enter your contact details

Paste:

IQ test results link

Loom video link

Answer all questions honestly and thoughtfully

Your answers matter more than perfect formatting.



Step 4: Live Video Interview (camera on)



This is where we get to know how you think.

I personally review every candidate who completes the steps above and will reach out directly to those who feel like the right fit.

If this role speaks to you, good.

That means you’re probably the kind of person we’re looking for.



Bring your best.

We’ll bring the system.



Link to Online Interview Form:

title: Social Media Manager (Graphic Design / Copywriter / Video Editing)
description:
The Vibe

YP Club isn’t just a network; it’s the infrastructure for the UAE's most ambitious young pioneers. We are building for founders and leaders scaling high-impact companies toward 8-figures. We’ve spent the last six months architecting our proprietary technology, the ExecutiveOS, and now we are ready to turn up the volume.



We don’t do "corporate." We do high-velocity, high-status, and high-impact. We are looking for a creative powerhouse to join us as our Content Architect and help us bridge the gap between "early-stage" and "global leader."



What You’ll Be Doing



Graphic Designer: You will be designing content to upload onto our social media 
 You will be writing the copy for all of our posts.



Video Storytelling: You will be the lead editor for our short-form content. You’ll take raw event footage, ideas, and voice notes and turn them into "Insight Gold" for Reels,, and LinkedIn.



Visual Design (Figma): You’ll own our aesthetic. From high-end carousels to updated brochure layouts and UI elements for the ExecutiveOS app.



The Pulse: You’ll join our Monday morning strategy calls to catch the vision for the week and translate our core pillars—Influence, Knowledge, and Wealth—into content that stops the scroll.



Analytics: You need to have experience in preparing content analytics once you've uploaded to ensure a constant growth from iteration.



Brand Guard: We have a strict, minimalist, and premium aesthetic. You’ll be the one making sure every single pixel we post feels elite.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

Master of Figma: This is a requirement. If you only use Canva, please do not apply. We build in Figma.

Elite Video Editor: You know how to use pacing, typography, and sound to make a 60-second clip feel like a cinematic experience. You're great with premiere pro. 

Copywriting mastery: Important that you are a master of copywriting. 

English Fluency: Excellent written English for LinkedIn copy and communication.

Strategic Thinking: You don't just "post images." You understand analytics, curation, and how to build an audience.



How to Apply

To be considered, please send a message with the following:

Portfolio: A link to your best Figma design work and video edits.

Experience: A brief summary of your work with tech or high-end lifestyle brands.

The Filter: Mention the word "Pioneer" in your subject line so I know you’ve read this entire post.

title: Graphic Designer (Marketing - PDP Assets)
description:
As a Graphic Designer on the Marketing team, you will bring the Sunco brand to life across every touchpoint. You will create digital assets for paid and organic social, display and banner ads, paid social ads, storefront, marketplace, and other marketing channels. You will help evolve and protect our visual identity through thoughtful logo work, style guide development, and consistent design systems.



You will sit on the design team, report to the Lead Designer, and collaborate closely with marketing, ecommerce, and marketplace teams. A key part of your role will be developing high performing PDP creative assets for our storefronts on Amazon and Shopify that clearly communicate product benefits and drive conversion. You will primarily work in digital but will also support print projects, including but not limited to trade show mechanicals, swag, and printed promotional material.



Note to applicants:

This is a full time role. We hire globally and welcome candidates from different countries and backgrounds. Regardless of location, this role requires your regular working hours to substantially overlap with 9:00 am to 5:00 pm Pacific Time (Valencia, California), Monday through Friday. Applications that are not send via the job link will not be accommodated.



What you'll do

Design landing page assets, and other campaign collateral with strong attention to hierarchy and UX best practices.

Develop and maintain high quality PDP creative for Sunco storefronts on Amazon and Shopify, including product imagery, infographics, comparison charts, and benefit driven visuals.

Work with the Lead Designer, marketplace, and ecommerce teams to ensure PDP assets are optimized for clarity, scannability, and conversion.

Adapt designs for different marketplaces and placements while staying true to the core brand.

Create social content for platforms such as Instagram,
, TikTok, LinkedIn, and others as needed.

Design digital assets for paid social, display ads, banner ads, retargeting, and other performance marketing campaigns.

Help define and evolve the Sunco visual identity across channels and formats.

Assist with the development of iconography, typography and style guide modifications for creative assets, ensuring all creative assets are aligned to brand standards and tell a consistent visual story.

Occasionally Design and build mechanicals for swag, event graphics, signage, and other print promotional materials.

Work closely with the Lead Designer to prioritize requests, manage timelines, and maintain a healthy workflow.

Collaborate with copywriters, marketers, and product teams to understand project goals and translate them into effective visual solutions.

Organize design files, maintain libraries, and follow naming and version control practices that support a growing team.

Take and apply feedback constructively while advocating for best practices in design and user experience.

Work closely with the Lead Designer to prioritize requests, manage timelines, and maintain a healthy workflow.

Collaborate with copywriters, marketers, and product teams to understand project goals and translate them into effective visual solutions.

Organize design files, maintain libraries, and follow naming and version control practices that support a growing team.

Take and apply feedback constructively while advocating for best practices in design and user experience.



Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in graphic design, visual communication, or a related field.

Proven experience as a graphic designer, brand designer, or marketing designer with a portfolio that highlights both brand identity work and digital marketing assets.

Demonstrated expertise in logo design and visual identity development, including style guide creation and system thinking.

Strong proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, Adobe XDa plus) and familiarity with Figma (we use this for design boards and feedback).

Experience designing for digital marketing channels, including social,
, web, and paid media, with an understanding of performance and UX considerations.

Experience preparing print ready files and working with vendors for print materials, signage, and promotional items.

Strong understanding of layout, typography, color theory, and visual hierarchy

Familiarity with basic UX and UI best practices for web and mobile and an ability to design assets that support a clean, user-friendly experience.

Experience designing PDP assets or ecommerce creative for platforms such as Amazon and Shopify is a strong plus.

Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to interpret briefs, ask clarifying questions, and present your work.

High attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast moving environment.



Additional Requirements:

Availability to work between 9 AM to 5 PM Pacific Time

Reliable internet access and a private remote workstation.



How to apply

/sunco-lighting/jobs?page=0

title: Billing Specialist
description:
About Change Craft

Change Craft is a mission-driven strategic communications agency working with public health, government, education, and nonprofit clients. We manage multiple client projects with detailed time tracking, invoicing, and subcontractor coordination. We are seeking a highly detail-oriented Billing Coordinator to own and manage our billing and expense processes end-to-end.

This is a process-heavy, accuracy-critical role. Precision, organization, and follow-through matter more than speed.



Preferred Working Hours:

Availability between 6:00 AM – 2:00 PM Philippine Time (PHT)

(2:00 PM – 10:00 PM U.S. Pacific Time)

 

Role Overview

The Billing Coordinator will be responsible for tracking hours and expenses, preparing monthly client invoices and backup documentation, reconciling project costs, and maintaining accurate billing and payment trackers. You will work closely with leadership to ensure invoices are accurate, complete, and sent on time—and that payments and subcontractor obligations are tracked and followed up on.

 

Key Responsibilities



Time & Project Cost Tracking

• Review and validate monthly staff and subcontractor time logs

• Track hours against project budgets and scopes

• Flag discrepancies, missing time, or potential overages

• Maintain clean, accurate project cost trackers



Month-End Billing & Reconciliation

• Prepare detailed monthly billing files for each client

• Reconcile hours, expenses, and subcontractor costs prior to invoicing

• Build clear, client-ready backup packages (time + expenses)

• Ensure invoices align with contract terms and billing schedules



Invoice Development & Delivery

• Draft and finalize client invoices

• Deliver invoices to clients according to required formats and timelines

• Maintain invoice logs showing invoices sent, paid, and outstanding

• Follow up with clients on outstanding payments as needed



Subcontractor Billing & Payments

• Receive and review invoices from subcontractors

• Ensure subcontractor invoices align with approved hours and terms

• Track amounts owed and payment timelines

• Maintain subcontractor payment trackers by contract terms



Expense Management

• Collect, file, and organize receipts

• Record and maintain expenses in QuickBooks

• Ensure expenses are properly coded and billable where applicable



Systems & Recordkeeping

• Maintain accurate billing, payment, and reconciliation trackers

• Keep organized digital files for all invoices, backups, and receipts

• Support audits or internal reviews with clear documentation



Communication & Follow-Up

• Communicate professionally with clients and partners regarding billing questions

• Follow up on missing information, approvals, or payments

• Escalate issues or inconsistencies proactively

 

Required Skills & Qualifications

• Excellent attention to detail and accuracy (non-negotiable)

• Strong written English communication skills

• Proficiency with:

o Microsoft Excel

o Google Sheets, Docs, and Drive

• Experience with invoicing, billing, or bookkeeping processes

• Comfort working with detailed spreadsheets and trackers

• Ability to follow documented processes consistently

• Strong organizational and time management skills

• Professional handling of confidential financial information

• Strong demonstrated business ethics and ability to maintain high degree of confidentiality and trust with sensitive information (non-negotiable) 

• Experience using QuickBooks

• Experience working with agencies, professional services firms, project-based billing, or hourly based billing 

• Familiarity with tracking billable hours and subcontractor costs

• Prior experience supporting U.S.-based companies

 

 

How to Apply

Please include:

1. A brief introduction and relevant experience

2. Copy of your resume or link to portfolio 

3. Your experience with billing, invoicing, or bookkeeping

4. Your monthly rate expectation within the posted range

5. Your typical availability and time zone

title: Service Operations Manager (Remote, KPI-Owned Role)
description:
## **Read This First**



This is **not** a virtual assistant role. \

This is **not** a customer support role. \

This is **not** a learning or training position.



This is a **Service Operations Manager** role with full ownership of weekly performance metrics.



If you are looking for a polite support job, flexible rules, or daily instructions, this role is not a fit.





----





## **The Role**



As the **Service Operations Manager**, you will build and run the company’s Services function.



You will:



* Personally handle service requests initially

* Design and enforce service workflows

* Hire, onboard, and manage Service Advisors

* Own weekly service performance numbers



You report directly to the Founder.





---





## **What You Are Accountable For (Weekly)**



You are measured on **three numbers only**:



1. **Service Bookings** (weekly)

2. **New Paid Members** (weekly)

3. **Customer Satisfaction** (accuracy and trust, not friendliness)



Performance is reviewed weekly.





---





## **What You Will Do**



* Handle service cases during the initial build phase

* Turn real cases into clear SOPs

* Recruit and manage Service Advisors

* Enforce documentation and escalation rules

* Monitor throughput and quality

* Escalate edge cases clearly and in writing



This is an operations role. You are expected to think, d
, and enforce.





---





## **What This Role Is NOT**



* Not customer support

* Not sales

* Not hospitality or concierge work

* Not a VA role





---





## **Required Skills (Non-Negotiable)**



* Excellent written and spoken English

* Strong written decision-making

* Comfort enforcing rules

* Ability to explain decisions clearly in writing

* Experience managing people or operations





---





## **Ideal Backgrounds**



* Operations management

* Service coordination

* Fleet, logistics, or insurance operations

* Complex support or service environments



Automotive experience is helpful but not required.





---





## **Compensation**



* **Base salary:** $4,000–$6,000 USD / month

* **Performance bonus:** Earned monthly based on hitting KPI targets



Compensation is based on capability, not location.





---





## **Probation & Expectations**



* Performance is measured from Week 1

* Weekly output is required, even during build phase

* Bonuses unlock progressively after probation

* Underperformance is addressed quickly



This role rewards discipline and consistency.





---





## **How to Apply (IMPORTANT)**



To apply, you **must** include:



1. A short paragraph explaining how you would build a service operation from zero

2. A written response to this scenario: \

A customer wants a vehicle service completed urgently, but the vendor is unavailable and pricing is unclear. What do you do?



Applications without written responses will not be reviewed.





---





## **Final Note**



We are looking for operators who can own outcomes, not assistants who wait for instructions.



If you are calm under pressure, clear in writing, and comfortable being accountable for numbers, we want to hear from you.

title: Social Media Ads Specialist
description:
About Us

Eterna Animal is a rapidly growing eCommerce brand in the pet industry, selling across multiple online marketplaces. We are looking for a highly skilled Ads Specialist to join our team. This role focuses on driving conversions through paid advertising campaigns across major social media platforms and Google.



Responsibilities

As our Ads Specialist, your primary goal will be to manage and scale paid advertising campaigns to drive conversions. You will be responsible for:



Running and optimizing ads on major eCommerce platforms, including:

•
 Ads

• Instagram Ads

• Google Ads



Key tasks include:



- Creating, launching, and managing ad campaigns to drive sales and conversions

- Conducting keyword research and bid optimization for better ROI

- Monitoring key performance indicators (ROAS, ACOS, CPA) to ensure profitable campaigns

- Scaling successful campaigns and pausing underperforming ones to maintain efficiency

- Managing product-level ads and promotions in alignment with product launches

- Providing regular reports with actionable insights and performance metrics

- Collaborating with the team on product launches and promotional strategies



Requirements



Must-have:

- Proven experience running ads on platforms mentioned.

- Hands-on experience with Google Ads and conversion-focused campaigns

- Strong understanding of paid traffic, conversion tracking, and campaign optimization

- Results-driven with a focus on scaling profitable campaigns and increasing conversions

- Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and manage multiple campaigns



Nice-to-have (but not required):



- Experience in the pet industry or related eCommerce field

- Familiarity with ads reporting tools



What We’re Looking For:



- A highly skilled Ads Specialist with a proven track record of running conversion-driven campaigns

- A professional who knows how to optimize campaigns for maximum ROI, not just traffic

- Someone proactive and results-oriented, who can take ownership of campaigns and drive growth

- A strong communicator, able to provide clear insights into campaign performance

- A team player who’s committed to contributing to the long-term success of the brand



To be considered for this role, please submit the following:

1. A brief introduction about yourself

2. A PORTFOLIO showcasing your experience with the platforms listed above. Please include CONVERSION-FOCUSED campaigns you’ve managed (screenshots, campaign results, or descriptions). We want to see proof of conversions, not just ads you’ve run.

3. Your expected monthly salary or hourly rate

Paid ads are at the core of our clients' growth strategies, and creative quality plays a decisive role in the performance we deliver.



We're expanding our creative ad production team and looking for someone motivated to contribute to high-quality, performance-driven ad creatives.

, Instagram)

Experience matters, but attitude and ownership matter more.

This role is a good fit if you:

This role is not a good fit if you:

- Why this role and type of work appeal to you



We're mainly looking for people who are serious about creative ads and want to do high-quality work.



Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Global Sales Executive (B2B Wholesale / FMCG) - Remote - $2,000/mo
description:
Philippines, Remote | Full-time

Reports to: CEO & Co-founder and Head of Sales

Pay rate: ~$1,500-$2,000

Mid-Senior Level



We are looking for a sophisticated Sales Associate to drive revenue for our global consumer brand. This is not a back-office support role; this is a "Pure Sales" execution role.



You will work directly with the CEO to hunt for new retail partners, manage wholesale accounts, and ensure our products land on shelves across the US, UK, EU, and Asia. You must understand the mechanics of selling physical consumer goods (pricing, margins, purchase orders, and logistics).





What You Will Do (The "Pure Sales" Cycle)

Prospect & Hunt: Build your own pipeline of potential retail and distribution partners. You will be expected to "pick up the phone," cold call, and set appointments.



Pitch & Present: Create and deliver high-quality pitch decks to international buyers. You must be comfortable presenting to decision-makers in US/UK time zones.



Close the Deal: Move leads from "Conversation" to "Purchase Order." You will handle pricing negotiations and finalize listing agreements.



Account Management: Conduct monthly calls with existing retail partners to ensure satisfaction, drive re-orders, and upsell new SKUs.



Global Coordination: Liaise with sales rep organizations in the US/UK and work with our Ops team to ensure wholesale orders are delivered successfully.



Who We Are Looking For

The "Hunter" Mentality: You are not just an appointment setter; you are a closer. You are comfortable with rejection and persistent in follow-ups.



Physical Goods Experience: You understand the difference between B2B Service Sales (BPO) and Wholesale Product Sales (Retailers, Distributors, Margins, MOQs).



Global Sophistication: You have excellent, professional English (written and verbal) with an accent and communication style suitable for high-level US & European markets.



Tech Savvy: Proficient in CRM tools (Salesforce/HubSpot), Google Suite, and presentation software (Canva/PowerPoint).



Dedicated Focus: This is a high-impact, full-time career role. We are looking for a long-term tea
mber, not a freelancer balancing multiple clients.





Requirements

3+ years of experience in B2B Sales, Account Management, or Business Development.



Experience dealing with Consumer Brands (FMCG/Retail) is a massive plus.



Willingness to travel occasionally for industry fairs or tea
etings.



Flexible working hours to align with US/UK business hours for client calls.



How to Apply Send your CV & Cover Letter to 
 with the subject line: "Sales Associate - [Your Name]" or submit applications directly through this link:

title: ROCKSTAR PART-TIME BOOKKEEPER with Excellent English and Great Attention to Detail!!
description:
Hi there! We’re hiring a part-time remote bookkeeper to support our growing accounting and bookkeeping team. This role will transition quickly to full-time based on performance and workload.



We’re looking for someone detail-oriented, proactive, and reliable — someone who takes pride in delivering accurate books and excellent client support.



Requirements

  - 5+ years of bookkeeping experience

  - 3+ years of QuickBooks Online experience 

  - QBO ProAdvisor (2025) certification is a must 

  - Experience with Double (formerly Keeper App), LastPass, Gusto, 
, A2X, or similar software is a plus

  - Solid knowledge of entering transactions, reconciliations, troubleshooting, and generating reports in QBO

  - Proficient with Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs, Drive, etc.)

  - Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  - Great attention to detail and organizational skills

  - Comfortable using WhatsApp, Zoom, and Loom for communication

  - Reliable internet connection

  - Must be flexible, dependable, and team-oriented

  - With great attention to details and able to follow instructions



About You

You’re someone who:

  - Works well both independently and collaboratively in a remote setting

  - Communicates clearly — both in writing and verbally

  - Is a fast learner and self-starter who doesn’t require micromanaging or constant hand-holding

  - Is dependable, trustworthy, and detail-oriented

  - Has a proactive, “get-it-done” attitude and takes full ownership of their work



About Us

  - We’re a U.S.-based bookkeeping and accounting firm that helps clients with bookkeeping, accounting, tax preparation, and tax planning. We also provide online training and resources for small business owners.

  - We move fast and value efficiency.

  - We treat our team with respect and loyalty — we grow together.

  - We reward great performance with bonuses and pay increases.



About the Role: Your key responsibilities will include:

  - Recording and categorizing transactions for bank and credit card accounts

  - Reconciling accounts and resolving discrepancies

  - Generating financial reports (Balance Sheet, Income Statement, etc.)

  - Maintaining accurate and up-to-date financial records

  - Supporting payroll tasks and client communications as needed



This role starts part-time (20 hours per week) but can quickly grow into a full-time position (40 hrs/week) based on performance and team needs.



Compensation

  - Weekly pay

  - Performance bonuses

  - Pay increases based on results and reliability

 with the subject line: “#JobOpp Application Submitted – PIZZA”

title: Virtual Associate/Virtual PA (Executive Support, Operations, HR and Finance Admin)
description:
About Magnus Consulting



Designed for Growth. Driven by People.



At Magnus, we believe in growth by design, for our clients and our people. Just as we help ambitious businesses decide where to play and how to win, we give our team clarity, opportunity, and the tools to excel.



We work at the sharp end of business transformation, asking bold questions, moving with momentum, and delivering meaningful impact with integrity. As a certified B Corp, with a client NPS of 95 and recognition as one of the top 20 marketing consultancies to work for in the UK, we’re proud to pair top-tier consulting rigour with the partnership mindset of an in-house team.



The Role



We’re hiring a Virtual Associate / Virtual PA to support our senior leadership team and wider business operations. This is a highly trusted, high-impact role supporting three partners, helping ensure the smooth running of internal operations, client coordination, logistics, and executive support.



This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, works proactively, communicates exceptionally well, and takes pride in producing polished work at speed. You’ll work across a range of areas including administration, scheduling, travel, operations support, light HR/admin, and finance support, while also helping maintain high standards across internal documentation and client-facing materials.



Because we work with enterprise clients and handle sensitive client information, we’re looking for someone who brings professionalism, discretion, responsiveness, and outstanding attention to detail.



Key Responsibilities



Administrative & Executive Support

• Manage calendars and scheduling for three partners

• Coordinate external meetings, send confirmations, and ensure key stakeholders are aligned

• Flag diary conflicts proactively, support agenda preparation, and ensure meeting readiness

• Support inbox and communications administration:

• Create, format, proofread, and update documents using Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)

• Maintain shared drives and internal documentation with strong file/folder hygiene and clear naming conventions



Travel & Logistics Coordination

• Book flights, hotels, trains, and other travel arrangment

• Prepare trip itineraries and travel packs (times, maps, bookings, contacts).

• Research venues for meetings, team offsites, or client events.

• Handle visa/entry needs (forms, letters, requirements search).



Operations & Project Coordination

• Support client project coordination by:

o setting up kick-off decks and timing plans

o following up with team members for deliverables and deadlines

o ensuring documents are client-ready and correctly formatted

• Coordinate subscriptions, renewals, logins, and permissions for key tools/platforms

• Assist with general research tasks and compiling structured lists (partners, suppliers, venues, journalists, event hosts, etc.)

• Help maintain internal libraries, templates, and business documentation to a consistently high standard



Website & Asset Administration

• Upload reports or case studies to our website CMS (WordPress)

• Support updates to service pages, team bios, and testimonials

• Ensure consistent formatting and brand alignment across published materials



Events Support (Remote Coordination)

• Help coordinate internal events and offsites (planning support, vendor research, timelines)

• Manage invites, RSVPs, and internal communications

• Support post-event follow-ups (thank-you messages, surveys, collation of photos/feedback)



HR, Recruitment & Finance Support (Light-Touch)

• Support recruitment administration (screening CVs, scheduling interviews)

• Assist with light HR admin support such as reminders, organisation, and onboarding support

• Support basic finance admin tasks such as:

o processing expenses and receipts

o voucher purchasing around key moments (e.g., Christmas, birthdays)



Required Skills & Attributes



Communication & Writing Standards (Critical)

• Immaculate English (written and spoken), you will be drafting and polishing communications and client-facing content

• Extremely high attention to detail across formatting, spelling, and tone

• Confident writing in a professional UK business communication style



Quality, Responsiveness & Ownership

• Highly responsive with fast turnaround times during working hours

• Strong sense of responsibility and ownership, you follow tasks through to completion

• Able to work independently, anticipate needs, and stay organised without heavy supervision

• Calm and structured under pressure, with the ability to prioritise effectively



Trust, Confidentiality & Handling Sensitive Information

• Comfortable working with sensitive information, including:

o internal HR and finance materials

o confidential client documents and enterprise client materials

• Discreet, trustworthy, and professional at all times

(This is a critical part of the role.)



Technical & Platform Skills

• Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

• Comfortable using online tools and systems such as:

o SharePoint / Teams

o Asana / Trello / Runn (project tools)

o HubSpot or CRM tools

o Wordpress (ideal but not essential if strong in other areas)

o Calendly, Zapier, and automation tools (a plus)

o Canva (a plus)

• Strong research and documentation skills



References Requirement (Mandatory)



As this role involves sensitive work and trusted access across both internal operations and enterprise client materials, all candidates must provide at least 3 professional client references.



We will need to speak directly with these references before confirming the start of work. This is a standard requirement across all Magnus staff and associates.



Ways of Working

• Remote position (Philippines-based)

• Part-time preferred (availability aligned to UK business hours strongly preferred), potential to increase to a full-time role as we scale

• Fast-paced environment with direct support to senior leadership

• High trust, high accountability role with varied responsibilities across the business



Ready to Apply?



Please submit your CV and a short introduction outlining your relevant experience, availability, and confirmation that you can provide 3 client references based in the UK and/or Northern Europe

title: Social Media Manager (EU D2C Brand) — Localized IG + TikTok Growth (Multi-language)
description:
We’re a fast-growing EU D2C consumer brand looking for a Social Media Manager to run and grow our localized social channels.



Scope (initially Instagram, later TikTok):

- Manage multiple regional/language accounts (e.g., German/French/Italian/Spanish/Dutch)

- Create and publish short-form content consistently (Reels/TikTok style)

- Localize existing footage into native-feeling posts (captions, on-screen text, simple edits)

- Build a repeatable content system (weekly planning, scheduling, posting)

- Coordinate voice-over production per language (freelance VO talent) as we scale

- Maintain basic community management (reply to comments/DMs where relevant)

- Track performance and iterate based on what works



Important context:

- We have a separate “main” brand account that stays the hero channel (and runs paid ads).

- These regional accounts are organic-first and should feel local, active, and human.

- You’ll have autonomy to d
 what to post, but within clear brand guidelines and a consistent content cadence.



What we’re looking for:

- Proven experience growing Instagram Reels and/or TikTok for consumer brands

- Strong editing skills (CapCut/Premiere/Final Cut — whatever you use)

- Excellent sense for hooks, pacing, and native platform style

- Comfortable running multiple accounts and content calendars

- Bonus: experience managing multilingual content and coordinating VO creators



To apply, please include:

1) 2–3 examples of accounts you managed (or a portfolio)

2) 3 links to short-form videos you edited (before/after is a plus)

3) Your proposed weekly output capacity (posts/week per account)

4) Your monthly rate or hourly rate + availability



We’ll start with a paid trial (2–4 weeks) and extend long-term if it’s a fit.

title: Shopify Operations & Influencer Coordinator
description:
Core Mission: To be the logistical heartbeat of Nicebeam. You will ensure every customer feels like a VIP, every influencer partnership is nurtured, and our supply chain runs like a well-oiled machine. You are responsible for the "Last Mile"—the experience from the 
nt a customer considers a purchase to the 
nt they receive their package.



Key Responsibilities:

1. Premium Customer Experience (Sales & Support)



Manage high-touch inquiries via
 and live chat, treating every interaction as a branding opportunity.



Resolve complex shipping or product issues with a "solutions-first" mindset.



Turn returns or complaints into positive brand experiences through empathetic communication.



2. Influencer & Community Coordination (Growth)



Outreach: Proactively identify and reach out to 20+ potential brand partners (influencers, biohackers, skin-care experts) weekly.



Relationship Management: Manage the shipping of "seed" products to influencers and track their posting schedules.



Affiliate Support: Set up affiliate codes in Shopify/GoAffPro and ensure partners have the assets (images/briefs) they need to succeed.



3. Logistics & Supply Chain Guard



Coordinate daily with our 3PL/Warehouse to ensure 100% fulfillment accuracy.



Monitor inventory levels across all SKUs and alert the Founder when re-order points are hit.



Manage the "Return Journey"—inspecting items via warehouse photos, processing refunds, and documenting defect trends to share with suppliers.



4. E-commerce Backend & Reporting



Audit the Shopify backend daily for order anomalies or payment friction.



Maintain the "Operational Health Dashboard": Weekly reporting on return rates, influencer ROI, and common customer friction points.



Source and communicate with suppliers regarding replacement parts or quality improvements.



Qualifications:

The "Proactive" Gene: You don't wait for a task; you find a problem and suggest a fix.



Articulate Communicator: Your English (written and verbal) is flawless, professional, and reflects a luxury brand tone.



Data-Sensitive: You enjoy spreadsheets and understand that "inventory = cash."



Relationship Builder: You are comfortable reaching out to strangers (influencers) and building professional rapport.



Experience: Previous experience with Shopify, Klaviyo, and 3PL software is a major plus.



Why Join Nicebeam?

We are a fast-growing, founder-led health-tech brand aiming for $10M. You won't be a "cog in a machine"; you will be a core pillar of our team with direct impact on our growth and customer happiness.



How to Apply:

We value attention to detail above all else. Start your application with the exact phrase: "I am the architect of Nicebeam’s digital retention."

title: Operations Manager (Remote)
description:
Company Background:

We are JIN Kimchi, a fast-growing F&B brand based in Singapore.

Today, we operate 12 locations with over 60 employees.

We run central kitchens.

We scale teams across operations, finance, and creative.

We move fast.

We build systems.

We care deeply about our people.



About the Role:

We are looking for a highly resilient and resourceful Operations Manager to serve as the "bridge" between the Founder and our growing remote team. You won't just be managing tasks; you’ll be the engine that keeps the entire company running. reporting directly to the Founder, you will oversee multiple departments, from HR and Customer Support to Marketing and Inventory.

If you are a "jack-of-all-trades" who can step into any role—whether it's legal, purchasing, or administration—and you thrive on making systems better, we want to talk to you.



Key Responsibilities:

Team Leadership: Manage and mentor a diverse team of Virtual Assistants (VAs).

Departmental Oversight: Supervise daily operations across Customer Support, HR, Marketing, and Inventory Management.

Systems Management: Expertly manage our workspace in Notion to ensure all projects and SOPs are up to date.

Daily Syncs: Lead and attend daily meetings to ensure alignment and remove "blockers" for the team.

Continuous Improvement: Proactively recommend and implement process improvements; we don't just want a "doer," we want a "thinker."

Direct Support: Act as the primary point of contact for the Founder, handling high-level administrative and strategic tasks.



Qualifications:

Experience: At least 3 years of industrial/operations experience.

Notion Power User: You must have significant experience organizing workflows within Notion.

Multi-Functional: Proven ability to juggle different functions (Sales, Account Management, and Customer Service).

Fast Learner: Ability to absorb new tools and industry standards at a rapid pace.

Resilient & Proactive: You are comfortable with the challenges of a remote environment and can "wear many hats" (the doctor, the legal eye, the biller) whenever needed.



Compensation:

Salary: 24,000 (Monthly)

Setup: 100% Remote / Work-from-home



Working Hours

Monday to Friday

9:00 AM – 6:00 PM (PH time)



Company Background:

Direct Impact: Work side-by-side with the Founder to shape the future of the company.

s, Reels, quote cards, captions, and interactive content—and enjoy seeing your work drive real engagement—this is the perfect role for you.

s, and captions

mbers to align content with brand goals and campaigns

NICE TO HAVE

title: Long Form Youtube Editor
description:
We’re looking for a high level video editor who can take raw multi camera footage and turn it into polished, story driven YouTube videos and high performing short form content. You’ll be editing long form YouTube episodes including podcasts, interviews, lifestyle content, and event recaps, then repurposing that content into engaging reels for Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts.



Your job is to make viewers feel something whether that’s motivation, laughter, tension, or shock while keeping pacing tight, intentional, and cinematic.



Responsibilities



Edit long form YouTube content ranging from 15 to 30 minutes, including multi angle podcasts, interviews, athlete features, lifestyle shoots, and business event recaps



Edit multi camera podcast episodes with clean angle switching, intentional framing choices, and strong conversational flow



Repurpose long form content into short form vertical videos optimized for retention and platform performance



Select music, sound effects, and ambient tracks that enhance emotion, energy, and storytelling



Add captions, graphic overlays, and light visual effects that align with brand identity and platform best practices



Understand and apply pacing and retention strategies used by top creators including hooks, beat drops, transitions, and pattern interrupts



Collaborate closely with the creative director to refine storytelling, structure, and revisions



Color grade footage shot in Sony S Log3, ProRes, and similar profiles to achieve a cinematic but natural look

title: Digital Marketing Account Manager – Agency (Healthcare Practices)
description:
Looking for a full-time digital marketing role with stable hours, ongoing client work, and a long-term position? We’re an established Australian digital marketing agency (operating since 2014) offering a stable career path, competitive pay, and a genuinely collaborative team across Australia and the Philippines. You’ll manage accounts for regulated healthcare providers, including local clinics and professional practices. This role is ideal for an experienced Digital Marketing Account Manager who is looking for: Employment stability with a long-term agency (not a startup)



*Fixed Philippines-friendly hours (Monday to Friday, 7:00am–3:00pm Manila time - currently 6am - 2pm due to Australia’s Daylight Saving time)

*Attractive, marketing-based pay 70,000PHP - 120,000PHP per month 

*10 paid leave days per year

*Additional paid time off over Christmas and New Year (for example, this year from 24 December to 6 January).

*Birthday and work anniversary gifts

*A friendly, structured team with daily support and collaboration



*** TO APPLY, COMPLETE THIS FORM 
 



Day-to-Day Responsibilities

*Client & Campaign Management

*Manage digital marketing projects for Australian clients

*Oversee
 Ads, Google Ads, SEO, and related marketing initiatives

*Act as the key liaison between clients and internal specialists, including by phone and sms

*Campaign Monitoring

*Monitor advertising campaigns weekly (Google and
) with paid media specialists

*Work closely with advertising specialists to identify issues and opportunities

*Ensure campaigns remain optimised and aligned with client goals

*Reporting & Performance Review

*Review reports prepared by the SEO and Advertising teams

*Ensure reports are logical, accurate, and easy to understand

*Communicate performance insights clearly to clients via written updates and/or video meetings

*Campaign Improvement & Strategic Input

*Contribute ideas to improve campaign performance

*Review competitors and market positioning

*Recommend website or landing page improvements

*Suggest creative changes to ad copy, visuals, offers, and messaging



*** TO APPLY, COMPLETE THIS FORM 



Required Experience

*Previous experience as a Digital Marketing Account Manager (required)

*Basic hands-on experience with
 Ads and Google Ads preferred 

*Understanding of SEO fundamentals

*Experience in healthcare marketing (e.g. dental, allied health, or other professional practices) is highly preferred.

*Experience working with Australian clients is a strong advantage

*Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken



Personal Attributes We’re Looking For

*Strong attention to detail with the ability to spot issues quickly

*Confident communicator (including by phone/video calls) who can clearly explain results

*Highly organised, reliable, and skilled in time management

*Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data, not just report on it

*Proactive and solutions-focused

*Comfortable working in a fast-paced agency environment

*Team player who values collaboration and regular check-ins

*Calm, professional, and client-focused



You will manage established clients and work alongside dedicated Google Ads,
 Ads, SEO, and web specialists. The focus of this role is account management, performance oversight, and strategic input — not doing everything yourself, but you can do it if required. 



*** TO APPLY, COMPLETE THIS FORM

title: Generator Technician / Mechanic
description:
Summary: 

The Generator Technician is responsible for the timely inspection, repair, and preventive maintenance of assigned generator sets to ensure reliable and continuous power supply. The role requires solid technical expertise in the repair and maintenance of diesel generators, particularly those used in large-scale commercial-type facilities, field installations, and major establishments where uninterrupted power is critical.



Key Responsibilities



- Perform routine inspections, preventive maintenance, and corrective repairs on diesel generator sets to ensure optimal performance

- Diagnose and troubleshoot mechanical, electrical, and control system issues, implementing timely and effective solutions

- Ensure all generators are fully operational, well-maintained, and ready for immediate use during power outages or emergencies

- Conduct regular testing, load testing, and operational checks in accordance with manufacturer and safety standards

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of maintenance activities, repairs, inspections, and service reports

- Coordinate closely with engineering, facilities, and operations teams to minimize equipment downtime and operational disruptions



Qualifications, Certifications & Skills



- Minimum of 5 years of proven experience in the repair and maintenance of generator sets

- Proficient in preventive maintenance, diagnostics, and corrective repair of generator sets

- Sound knowledge of diesel engines, electrical systems, and control panels

- Experience as a generator technician supporting large-scale temporary facilities or field installations is an advantage

- Ability to work independently and respond effectively to emergency repair requirements

- Technical Diploma or Vocational Certification in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Diesel Technology, or Power Generation

- Manufacturer training or certification from Caterpillar (CAT), Cummins, Perkins, Perkins, MTU, FG Wilson, or Kohler is a strong advantage

- Certification in Diesel Engine Maintenance, Generator Operations, or Power Systems is preferred

- Valid Electrical Safety or Industrial Safety Certification is an advantage

title: Amazon FBA OA & Wholesale Sourcing Specialist (US Market)
description:
Hello, I am hiring an experienced Amazon FBA VA to source profitable products daily for my US Amazon FBA business using Online Arbitrage and/or Wholesale.



???? This is NOT a beginner role.

You must already have hands-on experience sourcing winning Amazon FBA products. This cannot be your first Amazon job.



Main Responsibilities

-Source profitable Amazon FBA products daily

-Use Online Arbitrage and/or Wholesale

-Focus on higher-ticket products

-Analyze products using SellerAmp and Keepa

-Ensure all products are auto-ungated

-Submit a daily product sourcing spreadsheet

-Follow strict sourcing criteria



Product Requirements (Strict)

-US-based sourcing only

-Product price: $50+

-Minimum profit: $10 per product (higher is better)

-Minimum ROI: 20–30%

-Stable sales history on Keepa

-No restricted or gated brands/categories

-Must pass SellerAmp and Keepa checks



Tools You MUST Know

-SellerAmp

-Keepa

-Google Sheets / Excel

-Amazon Seller Central



Pay & Schedule

-$2.50/hour

-Part-time or full-time (flexible)

-Products must be sourced DAILY

-Long-term position if performance is strong



Who Should Apply

-Amazon FBA sourcing experience (OA or Wholesale)

-Already understands Keepa & SellerAmp deeply

-Hungry, consistent, and detail-oriented

-Willing to work long-term and grow with the business



How to Apply (IMPORTANT)

To be considered, include the following:



-Your Amazon FBA experience (OA or Wholesale)

-Tools you have used (SellerAmp, Keepa, etc.)

-2–3 example products you have sourced before (screenshots or explanation)

-Your availability (hours per day)

-Applications that do not follow instructions will be ignored.

title: Medical Biller (Part-Time, Remote | CST Hours)
description:
We are a growing women’s health and telehealth clinic looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Medical Biller to join our team part-time. This role is perfect for someone who takes ownership of their work, communicates clearly, and genuinely cares about doing things right.



Because we regularly handle insurance and patient calls from multiple countries and outsourced teams, strong, fluent English communication is essential for this position.



What you’ll be doing

• Medical billing and claims submission

• Payment posting and reconciliation

• Insurance follow-ups and collections

• Handling billing questions and phone calls professionally

• Working inside Tebra (Kareo), Athelas, and other billing platforms

• Tracking accounts receivable and reducing outstanding balances

• Communicating clearly with patients, payers, and our internal team



Optional additional hours available for

• Telehealth payment processing

• Light admin support

• Other clinic operations tasks



What we’re looking for

• Proven experience in medical billing and collections (required)

• Hands-on experience with Tebra/Kareo, Athelas, or similar systems

• Excellent spoken and written English with a clear, professional phone presence

• Comfortable handling frequent calls and resolving issues independently

• Highly organized and detail-oriented

• Responsible, proactive, and takes the role seriously

• Comfortable working remotely with minimal supervision



Schedule

Part-time

Must be available during CST (Central Standard Time) business hours

Flexible hours with potential to grow into additional responsibilities and hours over time



If you’re someone who loves clean claims, organized systems, and helping a clinic run smoothly behind the scenes, we’d love to meet you.



To apply, please use this form: 
 OLJ applications/dm will not be entertained.

title: Enter Credit Card Transactions into QuickBooks Online
description:
I need someone to manually enter 2025 TD credit card transactions from PDF statements into QuickBooks Online.



This is a data-entry and reconciliation task only — I will handle all expense categorization myself.



Tasks:

 • Enter date, vendor, and amount from each statement

 • Leave transactions uncategorized (do not assign expense accounts)

 • Ensure each month reconciles to the statement ending balance

 • For credit-card payments, use “Match” to the corresponding transaction from the bank account feed

 • Do not categorize payments as expenses

 • Keep the original memo/description intact

 • Flag any unclear or duplicate items for my review



Requirements:

 • Experience with QuickBooks Online

 • Familiar with matching transactions and reconciliation

 • High attention to detail

 • Comfortable working from PDF statements



Deliverable:



A fully entered and reconciled credit-card account in QuickBooks for 2025 with all transactions present, ready for me to review and categorize.

title: Part-Time X (Twitter) Engagement VA
description:
Hi! I'm a solopreneur running a portfolio of profitable SaaS apps. I'm growing my personal brand on X 
) in the indie hacker / tech / building-in-public space and need someone to handle daily engagement on my account.



This is NOT content creation. I write my own tweets and threads. Your job is the engagement side — replying to big accounts, commenting on peers' posts, building community, and managing notifications.



What You'll Do:



Shift (08:30 PM - 12:30 AM PHT):



Monitor and reply to posts from a curated list of large accounts (Elon Musk, Sam Altman, etc.)



Engage with smaller accounts in our niche — thoughtful comments, likes, follows



Respond to comments on our posts



Same as above — this is the US peak hours window so this shift is critical



Check and manage DMs (respond to simple ones, flag important ones)



Log daily activity in Google Sheet



Daily targets: ~40-50 replies, 60+ likes, track everything in a shared sheet.



Requirements:



Strong written English (you'll be writing AS me — replies must sound natural, smart, and conversational)



Familiar with X/Twitter (you use it or have managed accounts before)



Can type fast and manually (NO copy-paste, ever — this is a strict rule)



Reliable internet



Comfortable using: X Pro,
, Google Sheets, Chrome Remote Desktop



Nice to have:



You know what "indie hacking" or "building in public" means



Interest in tech/startups/AI



Experience managing someone else's social media



What You Get:



Full training SOP provided — exactly what to say, what to avoid, daily playbook



Long-term role — if it works out, this grows with the account



Performance bonuses for hitting milestones



How Account Access Works:



Chrome Remote Desktop (you control my PC remotely)



You never need to share personal info or accounts



D
 with:



A quick intro — who you are, your experience with social media / X



Write a sample reply to this tweet as if you were me: "AI won't replace founders. But founders who use AI will replace those who don't." — Just reply to it naturally, I want to see your voice. DO NOT USE AI FOR THIS



Please start your DM with the word ENGAGE so I know you read the full post. Also DO NOT USE AI to generate you whole resume. it is very easy to understand which posts are AI or not so i would consider only genuinely typed and read post with expereince



Looking to start ASAP. Thanks!
